name: Oluwole Ojewale, Ph.D
position: Regional Coordinator- Central Africa at Institute for Security Studies
text: Publication alert üîî   I am very pleased to share my latest paper published by the.  Non-state armed groups pose direct challenges to the character of states and strategic balancing of security in international relations. The existence of such actors has been a serious security problem in the Sahel for over a decade. Recently, their activities have been described as banditry‚àí a composite crime manifesting in wanton killing, kidnapping for ransom, levying of illegal tax on farming communities, sexual violence, trafficking of arms and cattle rustling.  Banditry continues to pose a significant security challenge in southwest Niger and northwest Nigeria, with its dynamics and trends undergoing constant evolution. Recent studies are largely concentrated on Nigeria‚Äôs northwest, and focus largely on the criminal economy of kidnapping for ransom and civilian onslaught by bandits.  Recent advances in their pursuit of violence pose challenges to local and regional stability in West Africa, international security, the rule of law, human rights, and socioeconomic development. Therefore, the study endeavours to answer pertinent research questions.  What are the dynamics of cattle rustling in the contiguous border regions of southwest Niger and northwest Nigeria? What role does the proximity of international borders play in facilitating cattle rustling activities? How do cross-border ethnic or tribal ties impact the dynamics of cattle rustling? Through empirical research, this study seeks to understand the internationalisation of cattle rustling and how it is shaped by multiple factors in the contiguous border regions of southwest Niger and northwest Nigeria.  50 free online copies of the paper can be accessed via the link belowüëá

name: Boston Bioskills Lab
text: Usually, you‚Äôd expect to pay a premium for a room with a view but what about a simulated operating room?  Well, no. At BBL, you don‚Äôt pay extra for the view.  Natural light and spaciousness are good attributes for a cad‚Äô lab and while they may not be high on your list of ‚Äúbioskills lab must-haves‚Äù who would say no, given the option?  More important, however:  - OR grade ceiling mounted surgical lights with camera. - OR grade radiolucent operating tables. - Intra-operative C-arm imaging. - OR grade instrumentation. - Bovie electrocautery. - Arthroscopic tower. - OR grade suction.  In fact, everything you‚Äôd expect to find in a hospital operating room.  recreates the clinical environment in to provide a realistic training experience.  Just try not to spend too long looking out the window.

text: üåü After a Long Wait, We Finally Made It! üåü  The journey of planning, fundraising, and execution has been a whirlwind, but in the end, every ounce of effort paid off! üôå My team and I successfully brought our community service project to Desa Mentari, and it was a truly unforgettable experience.  As a beginner in Malay, I was initially hesitant to engage with the community, but my amazing teammates,,, andencouraged and guided me in every step of the way. üí™ The most heartwarming part? This experience has been a beautiful reminder that small changes can create large ripples. name: Zeynep Burcu Yenipinar
position: Female Founder | Advisor & Growth Professional | Digital Marketing Enthusiast | Sustainability and Clean Energy Supporter | Passionate Startup Builder | Branding Expert | Athlete
text: Elon Musk Sues OpenAI Over Its Shift to For-Profit Status  Elon Musk has escalated his legal battle with OpenAI, filing a lawsuit to block the organization‚Äôs transition to a for-profit entity. Musk argues that this shift not only violates legal boundaries but also positions OpenAI‚Äîand its flagship product, ChatGPT‚Äîas a dominant force in artificial intelligence, potentially edging out competitors, including his own AI venture, xAI.  At the core of Musk‚Äôs complaint is the claim that OpenAI, led by CEO Sam Altman, has drifted away from its founding mission as a nonprofit dedicated to using AI for the common good. Musk points to OpenAI‚Äôs acceptance of significant funding fromin 2019 as a turning point, alleging that financial interests have overshadowed the organization‚Äôs original purpose. Musk‚Äôs legal team accuses OpenAI of engaging in monopolistic practices, arguing that the company, influenced by Microsoft and Altman, has violated federal antitrust laws. These alleged practices, according to Musk, include limiting funding opportunities for emerging AI startups, effectively stifling competition.  , however, has dismissed Musk‚Äôs claims, stating that his lawsuit lacks merit. The company emphasizes its commitment to innovation and transparency, despite the ongoing legal battle. This marks Musk‚Äôs third attempt to challenge OpenAI‚Äôs for-profit shift, following a withdrawn lawsuit in California state court and a subsequent refiling in federal court. In addition to seeking an injunction to halt OpenAI‚Äôs restructuring, Musk aims to prevent the company from entering exclusive agreements with investors that he views as anti-competitive. Meanwhile, Musk continues to grow xAI, his own AI venture, which has seen rapid valuation growth since its launch in 2023. The debate over OpenAI‚Äôs transition raises larger questions about whether the organization can remain true to its mission of serving the public good. While OpenAI has secured significant funding under its new structure, board chairman Bret Taylor has reassured stakeholders that the nonprofit arm will retain a meaningful role and a substantial stake in the company.  This hybrid approach was designed to address rising costs in AI development. However, the transition hasn‚Äôt been without controversy. Tensions over balancing profit-making with AI safety came to a head in 2023 with the temporary removal and eventual reinstatement of CEO Sam Altman, highlighting the internal struggles that accompany OpenAI‚Äôs evolving role in the tech world. This lawsuit adds another layer of complexity to the ongoing conversation about the future of AI development and the ethics of balancing , , and public interest.    Platform: Author:

name: Kwenga Emmanuel Sichilongo
position: Group HR Business Partner at Hollard Zambia |Labour Law Expert| Talent & Performance Mgt Specialist |Founder at Plenitude Consults |Published Author |BA PA | BA LIS |MBA |LLB Student |PhD Candidate
text: Small Interview Habits That Can Cost Big Opportunities  Your interview might be the most important step toward landing your dream job, but there are small habits that can cost you big opportunities. Here are some things to watch out for:  - Lack of Preparation: Not researching the company or role can make you appear uninterested. Always take the time to understand the company‚Äôs mission, values, and what the role requires.  - Arriving Late: Being late to an interview, even by a few minutes, sends the wrong message. It shows poor time management and disrespect for the interviewer‚Äôs time. Aim to arrive early and be prepared.  - Inadequate Body Language: Poor posture, avoiding eye contact, or crossing your arms can make you seem uninterested or unconfident. Positive body language like a firm handshake and good posture can leave a great impression.  - Over-talking or Under-talking: Giving overly long answers or being too brief can be detrimental. It's important to strike a balance‚Äîanswer the question thoughtfully, but stay concise and to the point.  - Speaking Negatively About Past Employers: Even if you had a bad experience at your previous job, avoid bad-mouthing employers or colleagues. Focus on what you learned and how it helped you grow.  - Bad body odor- I won't much to say here, I did a full post right on this one. Key is bath and smell good. Ladies will never go for a candidate who pollutes the interview room with bad odor; they are so sensitive.  Small habits like these might seem minor, but they can make a huge difference in how you‚Äôre perceived. Pay attention to the details, and you‚Äôll greatly increase your chances of securing the role!

name: Khalizan Halid
position: Executive Director at Codegen Technologies Sdn Bhd (All views expressed are entirely mine, except those I copied).
text: Continuing the Organizational Behaviour text on  hashtag #mooington because - let's not fool ourselves, even Hunter Biden got a pardon - understanding humans is important and what you know is less than who you know...  The pantry was dimly lit, the hum of the refrigerator filling the silence. Clara and Hawthorne sat at the small table, their voices low as though the walls themselves were listening.  Clara leaned forward, her mug cradled in her hands. ‚ÄúJenkins is either the luckiest intern alive or the unluckiest, depending on how you look at it.‚Äù  Hawthorne smirked, swirling the last of his coffee. ‚ÄúLuck? Please. That kid has the instincts of a blindfolded antelope in a cheetah‚Äôs den. Scrooge praising him? Proof that the universe has a twisted sense of humor.‚Äù  Clara chuckled softly. ‚ÄúStill, Tanker 8 was a good call. Saved the shipment, didn‚Äôt it?‚Äù  ‚ÄúSure,‚Äù Hawthorne replied, leaning back. ‚ÄúBut let‚Äôs not pretend it was planned. He was one sleepless night from emailing Tanker 11 just to see what happened.‚Äù  Grimshaw stood at the counter, intently dunking a tea bag into his mug. He looked engrossed, oblivious to the hushed commentary just feet away.  ‚ÄúI mean,‚Äù Clara said, ‚Äúyou can‚Äôt blame him. He‚Äôs navigating a maze where the walls move, and no one‚Äôs giving him a map.‚Äù  Hawthorne tilted his head. ‚ÄúAnd there‚Äôs Bloom. Jenkins goes in for answers, and Bloom hands him riddles. ‚ÄòAntelope this, cheetah that.‚Äô Meanwhile, the deadline‚Äôs breathing down his neck.‚Äù  ‚ÄúAnd ,‚Äù Clara added, nodding toward the pantry door. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs Jenkins‚Äô only support system. Not that the duck does anything, but he‚Äôs there.‚Äù  Hawthorne laughed quietly. ‚ÄúYeah, Jenkins‚Äô greatest ally is a duck. Says everything about this company.‚Äù  The sharp scrape of Grimshaw‚Äôs chair against the floor interrupted them. He turned, steaming mug in hand, clipboard tucked under his arm.  ‚ÄúTalking about Jenkins, are you?‚Äù Grimshaw asked, his tone carrying enough edge to make them sit up straighter.  ‚ÄúJust a casual chat,‚Äù Clara said smoothly, sipping her coffee.  ‚ÄúHmm.‚Äù Grimshaw‚Äôs gaze lingered before he strode out, clipboard tapping against his side. As the door swung shut, Clara and Hawthorne exchanged a glance.  ‚ÄúI‚Äôm telling you,‚Äù Clara whispered, ‚Äúhe‚Äôs onto us.‚Äù  ‚ÄúLet him be,‚Äù Hawthorne muttered, draining his mug. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs too busy perfecting his tea.‚Äù  From the hallway came a faint moo, unmistakably ‚Äôs. Clara stifled a laugh, shaking her head. ‚ÄúThis is turning into,‚Äù she said, ‚Äúa circus.‚Äù  ‚ÄúYeah,‚Äù Hawthorne agreed, standing. ‚ÄúAnd Jenkins? He‚Äôs the guy trying to tame the lions with a wooden spoon.‚Äù

name: Rohini Anand PhD
position: Strategic DEI Advisor | Highly Sought-after Board Member | Published Author | Esteemed Speaker
text: ‚ÄúI‚Äôve had a wonderful life,‚Äù is how John D. Kemp, author of Disability Friendly and President and CEO of Lakeshore Foundation, started his conversation with me. Born missing most of his arms and legs and losing his mother when he was 15 months, John Kemp‚Äôs is a remarkable story of courage and resilience. A story that led him to play a key role as a disability advocate on the national and international stage.  Today on International Day of People with Disabilities, in his book John Kemp reminds us that people with disabilities make up at least 15% of the global population ‚Äì more than 1 billion people- and are an underutilized talent pool. He provides us with a blueprint that organizations can use to make their workplaces disability friendly so that they can recruit and retain people with disabilities. Disability friendly workplaces make for enhanced innovation, team work and productivity that benefit all.  In my conversations with John, he credits his father who lost his wife - the love of his life- at 32 years and dedicated his life to fulfil John‚Äôs mother‚Äôs wish that John be given every opportunity in life. His father always encouraged him to do whatever he wanted including John‚Äôs childhood aspiration to be a baseball star. And he conditioned John to be independent ‚Äì just as he did with John‚Äôs siblings. John described vividly his seven block walk to grade school in N Dakota in 20 degree below freezing weather and 2 feet of snow.  In addition to a roadmap for organizations to build an inclusive culture for people with disabilities, John narrates his lived experience with candor and humor. He became a student manager of a basketball team so he could vicariously fulfil his dream and went on to law school and was co-founder of the American association of People with Disabilities (AAPD).  John Kemp closed his conversation with me by quoting his father saying that everyone in the school will benefit by John being in their classroom- a great analogy for workplaces where entire teams benefit from the presence and inclusion of people with disabilities.  This International Day of People with Disabilities, I encourage you to be a disability ally and to read John‚Äôs book. As the endorsement says, Disability Friendly is a must read book for any twenty first century leader.  You can order the book here

name: Dennis Ruh
position: Film & Media Industry Director | Film Festival Expert
text: At our last jury meeting, the members of the selection committee discussed the awarding of funding from the proMOTION program of the Ukrainian Instituteand. Together with my jury colleagues,, Sergio Garc√≠a de Le√°niz & Iryna Kyporenko, we agreed on the awarding of two films, which will certainly soon be shown at international festivals. The funding will help the efficient and targeted promotion.  And these are the films to discover:  * CUBA & ALASKA by Yegor Troyanovsky, produces by,&  The documentary Cuba & Alaska follows Cuba and Alaska, two female paramedics working on the frontlines of the war in Ukraine. Before the war, Cuba was a fashion designer, and Alaska worked in media. Their lives changed dramatically, yet their friendship and dedication help them persevere. The film captures their strength, courage, and dreams of peace, despite loss and hardship.  * MILITANTROPOS by,& Simon Mozgovyi, produced by Eugene Rachkovsky for Tabor LTD  The documentary Militantropos explores the nature of war through the stories of people experiencing it. The observational film showcases how war transforms lives: some take up arms, others lose their homes, and some begin to rebuild. The film focuses on both collective and individual experiences, transitioning from wide-scale destruction to intimate human faces. Militantropos serves as both a testament to the times and an exploration of humanity‚Äôs adaptation to war.  Coming soon to a festival or movie theater near you!

name: Gene Wahrlich
position: Head of Offensive Security | Driving security uplift initiatives that raise the bar
text: ùêìùê°ùêû ùêúùê®ùê¶ùê¶ùê®ùêùùê¢ùê≠ùê¢ùê≥ùêöùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß ùê®ùêü ùê©ùêûùêßùêûùê≠ùê´ùêöùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß ùê≠ùêûùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùêßùê†  Pentesting now seems like a dirty word.  This struck me when I was reading Open AI‚Äôs recent post ‚ÄúAdvancing red teaming with people and AI‚Äù, where they essentially describe pentests against their LLM. Anecdotally, it seems that suppliers are rebranding their pentest services to ‚Äúred team engagements‚Äù to stay relevant.  This observation is in a market where many OG pentest vendors have been acquired and rolled in to the consulting arms of multinationals, their identity slowly being forgotten. New vendors have popped up, but they‚Äôre mostly competing on price in a race to the bottom.  Automation in the SDLC, default defences included in development frameworks, and effective EDR has also chipped away at the premise (and budget) for pentests.  ùêÄùê´ùêû ùê©ùêûùêßùê≠ùêûùê¨ùê≠ùê¨ ùê¨ùê≠ùê¢ùê•ùê• ùê´ùêûùê™ùêÆùê¢ùê´ùêûùêù? ùêéùê´ ùêöùê´ùêû ùê≠ùê°ùêûùê≤ ùê®ùêßùê•ùê≤ ùêüùê®ùê´ ùêúùê®ùê¶ùê©ùê•ùê¢ùêöùêßùêúùêû? name: Apratima Biosolutions
text: Internship opportunity:  Overview: We develop protein engineering based solutions for plastic waste. The internship position is to study and document the funding and policy ecosystem in India which will be instrumental in designing the road map for the company.  Position: Internship preferably full time (Candidates interested in part time internships may also apply).  Qualification: Graduates in finance, commerce, management or relevant engineering streams.  Location: Remote.  Scope of Work: Funding for the sector 1. Describe the current landscape of foundation based funding available for finding recycling solutions for the plastic industry. This should also cover the foundations that have been investing in alternatives for plastics and focusing on circular economy projects and programs 2. Prepare list of CSR and philanthropies that provide grants and investments for the above purposes 3. Identify the investments made by HNIs in these areas ‚Äì grants and investments 4. Identify the corporate venture arms of large companies that are investing in circularity and plastics  Impact measurement 1. Capture impact framework, or how the grantees and investors measure  Impact of investments Policy landscape 1. Capture the relevant policies and any developments in the policy space that may accelerate the growth of this industry 2. Identify subsidies at state and national level for the sector 3. Study the work being done by NITI Aayog and identify where the research done by the company can plug in  Desirable: Familiarity with MS office especially Excel, or Google sheets or equivalent.  Salary: Unpaid internship.  Duration: 1-2months.  Deadline: 15 Dec 24 Apply through the link:

name: Kevin Karaca
position: Growing brands through impact communications | Messaging & Behaviour Strategist @ The House Outside
text: ‚ÄúCompanies are part of the community‚Äù Hunter Lovins says at ISPO   So why don‚Äôt brands engage with community?  Most companies take a top down, arms length approach to community engagement.  Rather than stopping, talking and listening to what a community needs.backed this up with the action thatemployees took recently to save a river in the Balkans. Risking arrest, Patagonia stood by these employees. Mix this along with media campaigns, legal action and supporting the tiny local grassroots NGO to turn bulldozers around.  So the question that remains is this‚Ä¶  What can brands do to engage with issues their community cares about?  To me, this is the ultimate thing a business can do: empower its community (read: customers) to do good.  Thanks for the fascinating discussion,&  ‚Äî  It‚Äôs great to be here withthis year. Thanks&.  üí° POW is one place brands can start to engage with their community.

name: Larry M.
position: Captain "Mac" @ The Military Party #VBUSA | Military Association, Veterans' Rights Advocate Freelance Writer and Journalist
text: A Call to Action: Reviving Leadership and Responsibility in America  General Michael Flynn‚Äôs recent message serves as a powerful reminder of the profound responsibility each generation bears in shaping our nation‚Äôs destiny.  His words cut through the noise of modern distractions, offering a stark critique of how far we‚Äôve drifted from the ideals of service, sacrifice, and steadfast leadership that once defined America.  Our generation, as Flynn notes, has too often chosen comfort over courage, consumerism over contribution, and feelings over principles.  We lament the lack of inspiring leaders, yet fail to foster the conditions for such leaders to emerge. Instead, we elect those who soothe rather than challenge us‚Äîleaders driven by optics, not by moral conviction or a commitment to enduring greatness.  Flynn‚Äôs call underscores a deeper truth: the erosion of our foundational institutions is not solely the fault of politicians or bureaucracies. It reflects our collective inaction. By prioritizing self-interest over service, we have allowed the very pillars of our republic to falter.  However, hope remains. As Flynn points out, we are blessed with an opportunity to reclaim our position as a beacon of freedom and strength. True leaders must rise‚Äîthose willing to take risks, stand firm on principle, and endure the trials necessary to secure a better future. But this requires more than words; it demands participation, sacrifice, and a commitment to teaching our children how to think critically and uphold enduring values.  This is a generational call to arms‚Äînot of war, but of renewal.  We must seize this moment to restore America‚Äôs greatness, not through empty rhetoric but through action, faith, and a recommitment to what it truly means to lead the free world.  Captain Mac üá∫üá∏üí™üî±

name: Yena Zhan
text: As we celebrate the International Day of Persons with Disability today, I want to share my recent experience with a temporary disability.  A few months ago, I broke my right arm, leaving my dominant hand and arm with limited functionality for about three months. This experience has given me valuable reflections in many ways.  Firstly, technology has been a game-changer. Despite my limitations, my work efficiency remained unaffected. My colleagues were amazed at how swiftly I could respond using just my left hand. When I revealed that our laptops have a voice input function in any language, they were astonished. I, too, was pleasantly surprised when I reached out to the Accenture Access Support Center and discovered that this feature was already available on all our laptops.  Secondly, an inclusive culture makes a world of difference. I was scheduled to facilitate a virtual global leadership program in October, but I felt overwhelmed by the preparation and facilitation required with just one hand. When I informed the faculty committee about my situation, they responded with understanding and care. This support made me even more committed to contributing after I recover. It showcases how inclusiveness boosts employee engagement.  Lastly, disability can unleash hidden potentials. I found myself putting contact lenses in with one hand and gaining a newfound curiosity for technologies that enhance accessibility.  If there is loss, there is also gain. This experience reminds us to embrace differences, uncover and support the unique talents of people with disabilities with technology and create an environment where their strengths are celebrated!

name: Muhammad Imran
position: Civil Engineering Enthusiast | Student at Obafemi Awolowo University | Dedicated to Transforming Ideas into Sustainable Realities
text: üåü Engineering Marvels in Action: The Unsung Heroes of Infrastructure! üåü  Ever wondered how roads stay functional during heavy rains or why railways rarely succumb to flooding? Meet the culvert‚Äîa brilliant civil engineering innovation that keeps water flowing safely beneath roads, railways, and other structures. With its diverse shapes like boxes, rings, and arches, this humble yet crucial structure ensures proper drainage, flood control, wildlife passage, and more.  As a proud Civil Engineering student at Obafemi Awolowo University (OAU), I'm thrilled to share this educational piece courtesy of Metrobuilders_OAU, our department's creative arm. Let‚Äôs take a moment to appreciate how such innovations make our everyday lives smoother, safer, and more efficient.  A big shoutout to OAU's Civil Engineering Department and all the passionate minds driving engineering solutions in Nigeria and beyond.  üí° Next time you spot a culvert, give it a nod of appreciation!

name: Zipporah Ongera
position: Freelance Virtual Assistant | ICT Support & Social Media Manager | Disability Advocate
text: We are celebrating International Day of Persons with Disabilities(IDPWD)  And here‚Äôs a back story of how i accepted that yes i am different  In 2021 there was a camp being run in Eldoret , the camp was for PWDS to get prosthetic arms  It was a free camp and i thought why not , I went to Eldoret for the first time  During the journey i was so uneasy something kept bothering me ‚ÄúSo yes , you will get the prosthetic arm , but you know it will be a decoration cause you lack the entire arm,  So will you be wearing it everyday? So will you start wearing sleevless tops ? How will life be in general once you get the prosthetic arm?‚Äù  With all these questions i got to the hospital where the camp was being held at and surprise i didn‚Äôt make it past the gate  I chickened out and told myself‚ÄùZippy hiyo mkono haitakusaidia‚Äù  As am celebrating IDPWD i celebrate me for accepting me and deciding that am perfect in my own way  To all PWDS out there the journey to self love and self discovery is yours to take  Take as much time as you need to accept yourself  Don‚Äôt rush it ‚ù§Ô∏èüòâüíã

name: Global Disability Inclusion, LLC
text: Today, is International Day of Persons with Disabilities! The United Nations recognizes this day to promote the dignity and rights of people with disabilities. This year's theme is "Amplifying the leadership of persons with disabilities for an inclusive and sustainable future." Focus Areas: ‚ôø Promoting the leadership of persons with disabilities in all areas of life. ‚ôø Ensuring the inclusion of persons with disabilities in all aspects of society. ‚ôø Increasing the participation of persons with disabilities in decision-making processes. ‚ôø Raising awareness of the rights of persons with disabilities. ‚ôø Celebrating the achievements of persons with disabilities.  ||  ID: An image of model Shaholly Ayers. Her dark hair is pulled back in a bun. She is wearing a high neck dress with an open collar. She has her right arm raised which is a white prosthetic.

text: üíêMy handsome Dad, with his heart of gold, is now with God, enjoying eternal life in His presence.  He fought the good fight, he finished the race, he kept the faith. 2 Timothy 4:7  Dad had a special way of loving with God‚Äôs love, always serving and blessing those around him. He taught me countless life lessons that have shaped who I am today‚Äîlessons I cherish and am honored to pass on to my own children.  While our hearts ache at his absence, we rejoice in knowing he is now in the arms of our Savior.  I want to thank everyone who has supported our family during this time with your prayers, encouragement, and love. Your kindness has been a source of comfort and strength.  Our family is truly blessed to have you in our lives. Thank you for walking with us through this season.

name: Akhil Paul
text: üí∞In 1999, Goldman Sachs paid $3.3Mn for a 33% stake in Alibaba Group & sold it for $23Mn in 2004.  üìà At the time, the 7x return seemed respectable after just 5 years.  üîç Shirley Lin, the Goldman China partner who sourced it, had initially suggested a $5Mn investment for a 50% stake, but this was deemed too risky by the board!  üí• By 2014, at Alibaba‚Äôs IPO, the Goldman stake would have been worth $12.5Bn , and at its all time high in October 2020, the value would have risen to ~ $50Bn !  It remains one of Goldman‚Äôs costliest mistakes.  ‚Äî  üèÜ In sharp contrast,founder Masayoshi Son‚Äôs $54Mn investment into Alibaba in 2000 remains one of the BEST investments of all time‚Ä¶  ‚ú® ‚Ä¶resulting in gains exceeding $ùü≥ùüÆ ùóïùóúùóüùóüùóúùó¢ùó° ‚Äî ùóÆ ùü≠,ùüØùü¨ùü¨ùòÖ ùóøùó≤ùòÅùòÇùóøùóª in just 14 years.  Son made this ‚Äúbet‚Äù on Alibaba founder Jack Ma based purely on his ‚Äúglow‚Äù & ‚Äúanimal charisma‚Äù  ‚Äî  üîéùó¨ùóÆùóµùóºùóº  ü§ùThe connections between Son, Alibaba & search enginerun deeper than most realize:  üë®üèª‚Äçüè´Before founding Alibaba, Jack Ma volunteered as a tour guide to practice his English.  üó∫Ô∏è In 1997, he was assigned to take Jerry Yang (Yahoo‚Äôs founder) on a tour, when Yang visited China.  Their conversations deeply influenced Ma‚Äôs understanding of the internet.  Shortly after Yang‚Äôs visit, Ma gathered 17 friends & co-founded Alibaba.  ‚Äî  ‚ôªÔ∏è Son‚Äôs connection to Yahoo: In 1995, he invested $100Mn into the company, substantially marking up Sequoia‚Äôs investment!  Just 4 years later, the investment was valued at $3.5Bn - a 35x!  While the dot-com crash reduced Yahoo‚Äôs value, Son went on to build Yahoo Japan into a success.  Yahoo itself played a major role in Alibaba‚Äôs rise, investing $1Bn in 2005 to acquire a 40% stake!  By 2012, Yahoo sold half of its shares back to Alibaba for $7.6Bn & earned another $9.4Bn during Alibaba‚Äôs IPO!  üí∞With its remaining shares appreciating further, Yahoo realised profits > $30Bn ‚Äîmaking this one of the most successful tech investments of all time too!  ‚Äî  üéÆ Son‚Äôs knack for spotting value extended beyond Alibaba to Nvidia, where he briefly became the largest shareholder after buying a $4Bn stake in 2017 (but sold for $3.6Bn)  ‚ñ∂ Son also offered Nvidia‚Äôs founder, Jensen Huang, the funds to take the company private, believing the market undervalued its potential back in 2017!  ‚ñ∂ Had he held on to his position, his stake would be worth $160Bn today - Ouch.  ‚Äî  Not all his intuitions paid off: Softbank lost $14Bn on their WeWork investment‚Ä¶  ‚Ä¶But they‚Äôre up $90Bn on their position in, the software licensing giant.  ‚öæ Son embodies the art of betting BIG & swinging for home runs!  ‚Äî  KEY lessons:  ‚ñ∂Companies pivot, founders are a constant. Back the individual.  ‚ñ∂Great companies compound beyond all expectations, hold on to your winners.  ‚ñ∂Sometimes intuition trumps numbers when analyzing an investment opportunity.  üì£ If you enjoyed this, üëâüèΩ follow me,, for more!

name: CPA Carolyne Njoki Maina
position: CPA, Msc Finance and Investment. B. Com Finance
text: TAXATION AND VOTING  Many people do not participate in things they don't identify with nor do they own what they do not contribute towards. In the recent past months, we have seen the white collar workers/salaried workers up in arms over taxation and the additional deductions in the payslip. This has resulted to more people engaging in public participation processes for various legislations and they now strongly feel they have a say on how the government is run and taxes are spent. Iam certain that there will be a sharp increase on the number of voters who will participate in the coming elections from that demographic. Next the government should expand the tax base without discrimination.(whoever will hack taxing the informal sector will be God sent,it will ensure the formal sector doesn't bear the burden of taxation and paying of some statutory deductions like housing levy and SHIF)I call it a burden because most people in the informal sector may be doing their annual tax returns but grossly understating their tax due, while a very big percentage does not do any tax returns whatsoever. When everyone(and by everyone i mean everyone who has an income generating activity) pays income tax, then no one will take 100 bob during election day and fail to vote, because we will all be stakeholders in this nation. We will all feel entitled to have a say on how our taxes are spent and the ballot will be our only saviour.Implementing this may seem difficult but it's the only way to ensure that we all equitably contribute to the development of our nation and it will be a blessing in disguise as people will be careful with the leaders they vote for, we will vote logically not emotionally.

name: Alex Ragalie
position: Principal Software Engineer | former CTO & startup founder | Rust ü¶Ä | aragalie.com
text: New year's resolution for 2025: find better ways to convey to other devs the sheer joy of using Rust ü¶Ä on a daily basis!  I know, each language is a tool bla bla blah, let's not get dogmatic and fanatic about a language, etc.  Not interested in any of that rhetoric, as I'm already convinced Rust ü¶Ä is the most amazing programming language we have today, by far better than anything out there, and I'm seriously committed to it for the foreseeable future.  So Rust ü¶Ä FTW, whatever others say.  From all the languages I've worked with for the last decade (Python, Javascript, C, C++, Odin, Zig, OCaml), nothing even comes close to the joy that you get while coding in Rust ü¶Ä  It's the mix of everything:  - incredible core language tooling - a compiler that guides you - you can express all the states of your program in the type system - amazing ecosystem of available crates - vibe and the attitude of people that develop open source things in Rust ü¶Ä (yes, they're quite different vs. those that mainly develop in C or C++ btw, at least in my experience) - you can go as low - or high - level as you want - you can build your program for virtually any platform out there, including web - how easy it is to build highly advanced CLI tools - the macro system that allows you to build any DSL that you want - how easy it is to jump into massive Rust ü¶Ä codebases and push PRs day 1 without fearing that you'll break the entire thing - the fact that so many more smart people are joining the ecosystem and help to improve everything, including Rust ü¶Ä itself  I could go on and on...  In case you've felt it already as well, how would youexpress this feeling in just one sentence?  ------ P.S - Was thinking that I could perhaps at least try to decrease the amount of bashing I do of other languages in 2025, but not sure I'll manage it tbh! üòÖ  It's simply too much fun to see others riled up and getting up in arms defending their poorly designed mammoth piles of yesteryear üí© (looking at you C, C++ and Python!) alongside their own comfort zones and their (humanly normal but not really sustainable) laziness in learning THE superior language üòÜ  No, the fact that "most of the world's low level code is written in C and C++" does NOT meant that you, or anyone else, should stick to those languages; their time is over, and we should all move on, for the betterment of your own daily life and that of our civilization.  Software is eating the world, so let's please all try to write better software!  You simply cannot write better software in languages like C, C++, Python or Java, no matter how much wishful thinking you or anyone else tries to apply to it.  So, just please queue up this way, learn Rust ü¶Ä and let's make the world a better place, for you and for me and the entire human race!

name: Trivitron Healthcare
text: The Flat Panel Digital C-Arm is known for its exceptional performance and high-precision imaging capabilities. By expanding care to every corner, Trivitron Healthcare C-Arms are not only advancing medical imaging but also making a meaningful difference in society. Their distinct advantages are shaping the future of dynamic X-ray imaging, enabling healthcare professionals to provide timely, accurate diagnostics, particularly in underserved and remote areas. These systems are well-suited for applications requiring rapid imaging speeds, such as dynamic imaging in surgical procedures, ensuring that communities everywhere receive the care they deserve.  For more details, visitor call us at +91 9840080008.

name: James Spencer MPhil MBCI
position: Global Political Violence Risk Consultant at AIG
text: If this account is accurate, it will do little to help restore the Police's reputation.   Swansea mother ‚Äòtraumatised‚Äô by arrest under Terrorism Act Haroon Siddique 2 Dec 2024  A Swansea woman has said she was left traumatised after being arrested under the Terrorism Act and held incommunicado for 5 days because her daughter was allegedly involved in an action against an Israeli arms company. Emma Kamio, 57, who runs her own homeopathy and pilates business, was led away in handcuffs from her home in front of her son and neighbours and had three laptops and mobile phones seized, after a Palestine Action protest at an Elbit Systems UK building near Patchway on the outskirts of Bristol. She was so traumatised by the incident in August that she has only recently been able to talk about it. Kamio said she was denied a duty solicitor for the first 2 days, and when she was transferred into the custody of counter-terrorism police she was held in a filthy cell, was searched repeatedly and the lights were left on all night, which she described it as ‚Äúpsychological torture‚Äù. The former nurse, who also has a younger daughter aged 16, said: ‚ÄúI disappeared from my family for 5 days due to the abuse of the Terrorism Act. [...] Kamio said she was initially taken to Swansea police station on 6 August and then to Bristol. She said her daughter Leona, 29, who lives in London, was brought from a different police station in Bristol and both were put in cages in the back of van, from which they could not see each other, for a high-speed blue-lights journey. [...] She said the cell in Newbury that she was initially placed in for 2 days had ‚Äúthe last occupant‚Äôs old dried faeces encrusted around the toilet‚Äù, and she was searched every time she left the cell (as was the cell) and again when she re-entered. Kamio spent her time in custody worrying about her family, her clients and the impact on her business, which she had struggled to rebuild after the coronavirus pandemic. [...] Kamio said police had not returned the electronic devices ‚Äì only one of which, a laptop, belonged to Leona ‚Äì her clothes and expensive sandals she was wearing when arrested, or her jewellery, including platinum earrings her late mother had had made for her. South Wales police said a complaint against officers was being investigated. Counter Terrorism Policing South East said Kamio was ‚Äúheld in conjunction with the relevant legislation and codes of practice for arrest and detention whilst in custody‚Äù. Thames Valley police said their cells were cleaned regularly and any concerns raised were addressed. Leona Kamio has been charged with criminal damage, violent disorder and aggravated burglary in relation to the protest, which the Crown Prosecution Service said had a ‚Äúterrorist connection‚Äù. They are not offences under the Terrorism Act. In total, 18 people have been charged in relation to the 6 August incident.

position: Principal Engineer & Co-Founder at Tronel | Embedded Solutions for IoT, Automation & Industrial Manufacturing ‚öôÔ∏è | Driving Innovation in High-Tech Industries üåê
text: Is RTOS really just for engineers?  If you hear the term RTOS (Real-Time Operating System) and think it's just another technical jargon, well‚Ä¶ you're right. But it‚Äôs also a game-changer in industries like automotive and automation, redefining how the modern world works.  An example? Imagine a driver assistance system (ADAS) that has to detect an obstacle and react before you have time to press the brake. Or a production line where a robotic arm stops in a split second to avoid a collision. In both cases, there is no room for delays ‚Äì and that's where RTOS comes in.  RTOS differs from ordinary operating systems in that it operates deterministically. What does that mean? It means that every task is executed at a predictable time ‚Äì always. It's like an orchestra, where a conductor ensures that every musician plays precisely at the right time. Without the conductor, we'd have chaos; without RTOS, we'd have systems that fail where precision matters.  At Tronel, we've been working with RTOS for years, designing systems that must operate in conditions where reliability and timing are non-negotiable. How do we use RTOS?  üîπ Minimize response time: In embedded systems, every millisecond matters. üîπ Prioritize tasks: Because brake response is more important than radio startup. üîπ Optimize resources: With an RTOS, even hardware with limited power runs at full capacity.  As a result, we create solutions for industries such as automotive and automation that work whenever they need to.  So, is RTOS something only engineers should care about? Personally, I don‚Äôt think so.  Its impact is everywhere, from the cars we drive to the production lines that build them. If you‚Äôve worked with RTOS ‚Äì or are curious about how it might help your project ‚Äì I‚Äôd love to hear your thoughts. Let‚Äôs discuss!

name: Giovanni Luigi Bordone (SFHEA)
position: Course Leader MA Marketing | DBA candidate @ London Metropolitan University
text: Graduations are always emotional‚Äîno doubt about it. But yesterday, one moment stood out and brought tears to my eyes ü•∫ü•∫ü•∫  A graduating mother walked across the stage, proudly holding her child in her arms. In those 15 seconds, she embodied a world of struggles, sacrifices, and triumphs: sleepless nights, childcare challenges, juggling roles, and the constant balancing act of family, work, and studies.  I have immense respect for people like her‚Äîthose who defeat the odds and keep pushing uphill until they succeedü•áü•á. These are the true heroes of our society. They may not have had their path mapped out for them, but they take their destiny into their own hands and persevere.  Education empowers individuals, but it also inspires the next generation. This child will grow up looking at their mother as a role model‚Äîa shining example of determination, resilience, and strength. And most likely, they‚Äôll follow in her footsteps.  To all those who walk this incredible journey: you are an inspiration. in

position: CEO Fampire Group (Love Brands | Investor | Agency Group vom stein&zubrod.)
text: ‚Äû...ùêßùê¢ùêúùê°ùê≠ ùê¶ùêöùê• ùêùùê¢ùêû ùêå√ºùê°ùêû ùê¶ùêöùêúùê°ùêûùêß, ùêùùê¢ùêû ùêíùêúùê°ùê´ùê¢ùêüùê≠ùêöùê´ùê≠ ùê≥ùêÆ √§ùêßùêùùêûùê´ùêß, ùêÆùê¶ ùê≥ùêÆ ùêØùêûùê´ùê¨ùêúùê°ùê•ùêûùê¢ùêûùê´ùêß, ùêùùêöùê¨ùê¨ ùêíùê¢ùêû ùê¶ùê¢ùê≠ ùêÇùê°ùêöùê≠ùêÜùêèùêì ùêöùêßùê≠ùê∞ùê®ùê´ùê≠ùêûùêß.‚Äú  Gestern wurde ich mit genau dieser Aussage in meiner PR Agenturkonfrontiert, weil ich bei einer E-Mail Antwort KI-Unterst√ºtzung verwendet habe.  Die Unterstellung:  Meine schnelle Reaktion sei unpers√∂nlich und weil offensichtlich die Antwort mit ChatPGT erstellt wurde, schenkt der Kunde meiner Kompetenz weniger Glaube.  Meine Antwort darauf - ganz n√ºchtern und ohne Scham:  "Ich entschuldige mich nicht daf√ºr, Technologie zu nutzen, um effizient zu sein. Der Inhalt meiner E-Mail ist echt und inhaltlich korrekt, denn die KI antwortet basiert auf meiner 15-j√§hriges Brand Expertise. Wir sind eine der f√ºhrenden PR Agenturen, weil wir mehr k√∂nnen als manuell eine E-Mail zu verfassen."  Wann ich das so mache mit KI und E-Mail?  Immer, √ºberall üòÇ - das Foto ist ein echtes Beispiel: üëâ Ehemannhat Flugstunde mit Kind 1 auf dem Arm und ich bin als Supporterin aka Chauffeurin nur physisch anwesend und beantworte halt nebenbei fix E-Mails.  Zwischen Familie, Business und dem echten Leben drau√üen, beantworte ich meine Inbox gerne mal mithilfe von Diktierfunktion und ChatGPT. Eine cleane E-Mail Inbox stresst mich weniger und ich weigere mich meine Zeit zu verschwenden eine E-Mail hundert Mal quer lesen zwecks Korrektheit. KI macht mich entspannter.  Zumal ich zwar starke Rechtschreib- und Grammatikskills besitze (Deutsch Abitur 14 Punkte, ü§ì), aber ich leide an einer Krankheit, sodass mein Hirn einzelne W√∂rter verschluckt, weil es zu schnell denkt und liest. KI l√§sst mich weniger dumm wirken.  KI ist f√ºr mich ein Werkzeug, kein Ersatz.  Sie hilft bei Details wie Rechtschreibung und Formulierungen, w√§hrend ich mich auf die Qualit√§t und Strategie konzentriere. Sie hilft mir schnell zu sein, sie hilft mir die freigewordene Zeit in einen Anruf zu investieren, um f√ºr meinen PR Kunden eine geile einzigartige Idee zu starten. Eine Idee, die einzigartig in meinem Brain entsteht, die KI oder eine andere Agentur nicht einfach umsetzen k√∂nnen.  Um Missverst√§ndnisse zu vermeiden, habe ich meine Signatur jetzt angepasst:  ùë∫ùíÜùíèùíï ùíÉùíö ùíäùë∑ùíâùíêùíèùíÜ, ùíïùíöùíëùíÜùíÖ ùíòùíäùíïùíâ ùíïùíâùíñùíéùíÉùíî. ùë™ùíìùíÜùíÇùíïùíäùíêùíè ùíîùíñùíëùíëùíêùíìùíïùíÜùíÖ ùíÉùíö ùë®ùë∞, ùíéùíÜùíîùíîùíÇùíàùíÜ ùíñùíèùíáùíäùíçùíïùíÜùíìùíÜùíÖ‚ÄîùíëùíçùíÜùíÇùíîùíÜ ùíÜùíôùíÑùíñùíîùíÜ ùíïùíöùíëùíêùíî!  Die eigentliche Frage ist f√ºr mich nicht, ob man KI nutzt ‚Äì das tun wir alle in irgendeiner Form. Es geht vielmehr darum, wie wir Technologie nutzen, um noch besseren Mehrwert zu liefern und uns Freir√§ume f√ºr das Wesentliche zu schaffen. Uns gegenseitig vorwerfen KI einzusetzen und dadurch inkompetenter zu sein, finde ich deplatziert.  Wie steht ihr dazu:  Schafft Technologie f√ºr euch mehr Raum f√ºr Kreativit√§t und Qualit√§t oder begegnet ihr immer noch oft Skepsis?

text: üöÄ Day 34 of  hashtag #100DaysOfFlexiblePackaging Journey Exploring the Role of Automation in Flexible Packaging Automation is revolutionizing the flexible packaging industry by enhancing efficiency, precision, and sustainability. Today, let‚Äôs dive into how automation is reshaping processes and solving long-standing challenges. Key Benefits of Automation 1Ô∏è‚É£ Enhanced Quality Control: Advanced sensors and AI-driven systems ensure defect-free packaging. Real-time monitoring of parameters like seal integrity, material thickness, and print alignment. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Increased Speed and Efficiency: Robotic arms and high-speed systems reduce production times. Minimized human intervention leads to consistent results. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Sustainability: Automation optimizes material use, reducing waste. Energy-efficient machinery supports eco-friendly production. 4Ô∏è‚É£ Cost Optimization: Reduced labor costs and fewer errors lower operational expenses. Long-term ROI from improved productivity and lower downtime. Examples of Automation in Action Smart Coating Systems: Automated equipment ensures even application of barrier coatings. Digital Printing: High-speed printers adjust settings dynamically for precision and efficiency. Robotic Sorting: Advanced sorting systems streamline the recycling process for sustainable packaging. Takeaway Automation is no longer a luxury; it‚Äôs a necessity for manufacturers aiming to stay competitive in the packaging world. By embracing these technologies, we‚Äôre paving the way for more efficient and sustainable production processes. üì¢ Discussion Prompt: How do you see automation impacting the packaging industry in the next five years?

name: Alex Evans, PhD
position: Civil Society Consultant and Researcher | Director, Alex Evans Consulting | Associate, Moore Kingston Smith Nonprofit | Associate Director, Big Local Works | Faculty Member, DMT Academy
text: So Relate‚Äôs central body is in trouble. Is there a developing issue with some versions of the federated model? Spreading risk, allowing local and diversified funding, multiple T&F grants, and sharing expertise, as well as brand recognition, are seen to be the benefits: all good.  But in some ways the overheads problem gets magnified. Each of these federated local organisations has its own overheads anyway. Then you have another massive overhead.  The expertise the centre brings - and certainly any funding - can be limited, and many local organisations complain that they simply don‚Äôt know what the centre does except give them branding guidelines and ask for reports. (Not all - some federations I know work very well.)  And then you have a sort of centralised head without a body. You have central costs writ-large with comparatively limited ways to apportion those costs. You may look at making local branches contribute to those, but that tends not to be popular.  Taking on some contracts directly for the ‚Äòhead‚Äô (ie centre) and looking for grants may help, but trusts funding goes to delivery and they don‚Äôt like core costs even at delivery level. Local contracts are where most remaining public sector money is (if any) and you‚Äôre less likely to get them because you‚Äôre not local and you don‚Äôt want to compete with your branches.  Of course they mostly surivive on individual donations, but with those going down like a knackered lift, that has to be more and more difficult - and the other options are so much less available.  I hope Relate can pull it together, but sadly I fear that this is a trend and we will see other franchises‚Äô centres go. Of course that then hugely damages the infrastructure the sector needs again.  And finally, staff not getting redundancy. FFS get it together people. NOT OKAY.  [Note: the guardian author doesn‚Äôt fully explain the model and the operating structure/ legal structure here. Was it just the trading arm?]

text: üêæ Puppy Pose ‚Äì Zepplin Style üêæ  Inspired by Zepplin, our future assistance dog in training who is living with us at the moment, let‚Äôs take a moment to embrace the Puppy Pose (Uttana Shishosana) to release the crazy of this time of the year  This gentle yoga pose stretches the spine, shoulders, and chest, offering a calming and restorative experience.  Just like Zepplin, it teaches us to stay playful, grounded, and full of heart.  ‚ú® Benefits of Puppy Pose:  1Ô∏è‚É£ Spinal Release: Eases tension in the upper and lower back, creating space along the spine.  2Ô∏è‚É£ Opens the Heart: A gentle chest opener, encouraging deeper breathing and a sense of vulnerability.  3Ô∏è‚É£ Relieves Stress: Promotes relaxation, helping to quiet the mind and reduce anxiety.  4Ô∏è‚É£ Improves Flexibility: Stretches shoulders, arms, and hips for improved mobility.  5Ô∏è‚É£ Playful Energy: Reminds us to stay lighthearted and curious, just like a puppy.  This tim of the year can create lots of stress anxiety or overwhelm. If this happens channel Zepplin‚Äôs playful energy and try Puppy Pose. text: ‚úîÔ∏èDesign & Manufacturing   üî∏Jetway Information Co., Ltd. is an Original Design Manufacturer (ODM) and a custom manufacturing service provider focused on delivering quality solutions to Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs), with a world-class reputation. text: Good Morning! A blessed day to you!   I thank God for granting this bright and joyful Tuesday, December 3rd, 2024, wishing you love, joy, and peace.  I also thank God for His Son Jesus, our Savior who protects those who follow him with the whole heart.  The Bible declares that our Lord looks after those who put their trust in Him.  The Bible declares also that our Lord Jesus gives tender care to those who follow after him.  Therefore, my prayer is that you will sincerely follow our Lord Jesus, so that he will not be grieved with any sinful way.  Indeed, I pray that you will follow our Lord Jesus in truth, for He looks after you with tender care.  Most of all, I pray that you will walk sincerely with our Lord Jesus, for He will protect you from the pitfalls of sin.  Without doubt, protecting with tender care is in God‚Äôs love. You are also in my love, and are mentioned daily in my prayers.  Now, may our Lord Jesus, who protects with tender care those who follow him, be with you throughout this day. Therefore, my brothers and sisters, let‚Äôs put our trust in our Lord! For he will protect us; he will not fail us, nor forsake us. name: Joanna Diamond
position: Rental Guru - Property Partner - Honest (no BS) Advice from an ADHD business owner
text: ‚ú® I've been in some positions in my time ‚ú®   People often say they‚Äôd love to work in property, but let‚Äôs be honest, it‚Äôs not the glamorous world you see on Selling Sunset. Yesterday, for example, I found myself on my hands and knees in the rain with my arm down a water meter grid, just trying to take a meter reading. üåßÔ∏è Someone came over to try and help me get up because they thought I‚Äôd had a fall. Oh no, who is that old lady on all fours!!! Is she OK?  And if you think that‚Äôs bad, imagine trying to do the same thing with a meter covered in spiders' webs and mud. Not exactly the luxury lifestyle you see on TV, is it? üï∑Ô∏è I‚Äôve seen grown men run screaming from the creepy crawlies we have to deal with.  The truth is, property work requires a lot of grit, perseverance, and getting your hands dirty (literally and figuratively). It‚Äôs a mix of problem-solving, physical work, and dealing with unpredictable situations every day. So, next time you think of working in property, remember: it‚Äôs not all sunshine and showrooms. But when it all comes together, it‚Äôs incredibly rewarding. üí™  Love my job. üòç üòç üòç

text: The Man! The Myth!! The Legend!! The Albert Ekka, Paramvir Chakra(P).  3rd December 1971. The day Pakistan attacked India's airbase and which allowed India to retaliate on eastern and western fronts.  14 Guards were given the task to capture an extremely important and strategic Pakistani position at Gangasagar, Brahmanbarhia district of what was then East Pakistan. The post was heavily fortified and mined.  When 14 Guards reached the post, they were subjected to intense shelling and small arms fire by the enemy. Lance Naik Ekka spotted an enemy light machine gun firing from a bunker causing heavy casualties to the Indian troops.  Unmindful of personal safety, Lance Naik Albert Ekka charged at the bunker, killed two enemies with his knife and secured the bunker. But in the process he was seriously injured. The story does not end here and he did not stop there. He continued his advance with his company, securing bunker after bunker. Soon they reached the northern end of their objective. This time a medium machine gun fire inflicted heavy casualties to the Indian troops. Once again, Lance Naik Ekka rose to the occasion and charged at the MMG position. He threw a hand grenade inside the bunker and killed the remaining enemies with his bayonet(a knife attached with a gun).  Lance Naik Albert Ekka attained Veergati. He was awarded the nation‚Äôs highest gallantry award, ‚ÄúParamVir Chakra(P)‚Äù for his raw courage and unyielding fighting spirit. Remembering the Legend on the day he attained Veergati.

name: Al Bagocius
position: Because finding the Right Place for Mom and Dad means everything!
text: When comparing your height to the width of your arm spread, also called "wingspan,‚Äù a roughly equal measurement indicates a typical body proportion, while a significantly larger arm span than your height could potentially suggest a genetic predisposition to conditions like Marfan Syndrome.  About 1 in 5,000 people have Marfan syndrome, including men and women of all races and ethnic groups. Learn more about Marian Syndrome  Or it could simply be a natural variation depending on your body type.  If your arm span is considerably smaller than your height, it could indicate a different body structure or potential developmental issues.  For most people, their arm span is very close to their height, meaning the ratio is around 1:1.  To accurately assess your arm span to height ratio, make sure to measure correctly by fully extending your arms out to the side at shoulder level while standing with your feet together.  If you have concerns about your arm span compared to your height, especially if you have other potential symptoms of a genetic condition, it's important to consult a doctor for proper evaluation.

LPDDR4 2GB RAM + 16GB EMMC Storage: Comes with 2GB LPDDR4 RAM and 16GB EMMC storage, providing good speed and sufficient storage for apps and media. text: EN: On the 27th of November, we attended the first day of the Logistics and Automation, Empack, and Logistic Industrial Build event in Madrid. The fair showcased cutting-edge innovations in logistics and automation, emphasizing the shift towards digitization and process optimization. It was remarkable to witness advancements in warehouse management, featuring robots and articulated arms streamlining operations, as well as RFID technology enabling complete stock and inventory control in record-breaking times. The event also highlighted the growing importance of sustainability and innovation in the sector, with insightful workshops and demonstrations on last-mile optimization, AI-driven supply chain solutions, and efficient transport systems. These trends reaffirm the pivotal role of technology in shaping the future of logistics and underline the need for continuous adaptation in this fast-evolving industry.  ES: El pasado 27 de noviembre asistimos al primer d√≠a de la feria Logistics and Automation, Empack y Logistic Industrial Build en Madrid. El evento fue una excelente oportunidad para explorar las √∫ltimas innovaciones en log√≠stica y automatizaci√≥n, con un claro enfoque en la digitalizaci√≥n y la optimizaci√≥n de procesos. Fue impresionante ver los avances en la gesti√≥n de almacenes, con robots y brazos articulados agilizando las operaciones, y tecnolog√≠as como el RFID permitiendo el control completo de inventarios en tiempos r√©cord. Tambi√©n se destacaron aspectos clave como la sostenibilidad y la innovaci√≥n tecnol√≥gica, con talleres pr√°cticos sobre optimizaci√≥n de la √∫ltima milla, soluciones de cadena de suministro impulsadas por IA y sistemas de transporte m√°s eficientes. text: hashtag #India has sharply reduced orders for  hashtag #defense  hashtag #equipment with  hashtag #Russia and is now buying more from  hashtag #Western  hashtag #suppliers, officials said, a significant policy shift for a nation traditionally reliant on from .  India and Russia‚Äôs plans to jointly develop and manufacture helicopters and advanced fighter jets were shelved some time ago, according to senior Indian officials.  A separate proposal to lease a powered from Russia to train Indian crew is also unlikely to move forward, noting that the South Asian nation is building its own vessels. Two warships and batteries for an anti-missile shield, which were ordered prior to the war in Ukraine, are the only outstanding items New Delhi has yet to receive from Moscow.  India, the world‚Äôs biggest importer of weapons, has been buying less and less from Russia. Only 36% of India‚Äôs arms imports came from Russia last year, down from 76% in 2009, according to a March report from the , an independent think tank that studies conflict, weapon sales and disarmament.  India‚Äôs move to wean itself off Russian weapons underscores ‚Äôs efforts to steadily reduce its dependence on Moscow, even as his government continues to buy cheap from Russia and provide diplomatic support to . India at the same time has moved closer into the US defense orbit, providing an anchor for the relationship just as comes into office threatening higher .  New Delhi‚Äôs shift from Russia has helped US based suppliers. According to the , India is now buying more from Western companies and trying to build homemade weapons with support from the US and . Over the past two decades, Washington has eased restrictions barring developing countries from accessing advanced technology.  Since 2018, India has inked contracts worth nearly $20 billion for US made products, according to a report from the US Service. In October, the South Asian country green lit a more than $3 billion deal for 31 long range drones made by US defense giant .

text: I am hiring for a Power & Performance Optimization Lead at AMD  We are looking for a technical leader with extensive experience in x86, ARM, or GPU hardware or firmware development with a passion for power and performance validation and optimization spanning low-power mobile to console-level devices. This person should thrive in a matrixed environment spanning multiple countries and time zones and enjoy working hands-on in a lab environment.  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:  Lead planning and execution of post-silicon power or performance validation and optimization of custom silicon Work onsite in the lab to execute pre- and post-silicon tasks Collaborate with manufacturing and customer engineering to support product definition and enable production Develop deep expertise in existing and new power and performance features Perform pre- and post-silicon power and performance correlation, debug, and analysis Develop test plans for power or performance validation Debug and troubleshoot system level issues related to power and performance  Mentor junior team members and provide technical guidance through the planning and execution phases of post-silicon power or performance attainment and optimization efforts Develop relationships and collaborate with key internal and external stakeholders Clearly document all test procedures and results for both internal and external customers  Please reach out to , , , , ,   Use the below link for applying.

name: Isabel Barton
position: Mechatronics Engineering and Computer Science Student at The University of Queensland | Liveris Academy Scholar
text: Wow what a year!  2024 has been filled with personal and professional adventures alike. Now that December has arrived, I thought it might be time to reflect before the new year begins.  In February I spent 2 weeks withon an educational trip, where I learned that despite language barriers, a smile can be understood anywhere. As strangers became friends, they welcomed us into their homes, shared their stories, and taught me the power of listening. I also discovered that engineering doesn't always mean mechanical or electrical solutions. Have you heard of? They train Magawa rats to sniff out landmines to save live! Pretty ingenious.  Then it was back to university, where I completed my favourite course yet with a team of 5. We built a robot with an extending arm and rotating base to pick up six tennis balls from various locations and heights. This challenge taught me that not knowing the answer often means you are about to do something pretty fun.  and, though vastly different in their goals‚Äîone raising suicide awareness, the other exploring the intersection of neurology, consciousness and technology‚Äîare two volunteer organisations I am incredibly proud to be a part of. What I‚Äôve learned from both is honestly too much to put into words here. Maybe we should all volunteer a little more often :)  Next... A my largest mountain yet‚Äînot mentally but physically. Mt Fugi from base to top and back down again. I climbed Mount Fuji from base to summit and back down again. I learned that my mind might be weak, but my legs are strong. Also, I realised that I probably couldn‚Äôt live in a cold climate! But seriously, we should all go on more physical adventures it's good for the mind.  Lastly, my greatest highlight of the year was atin China. I spent a month with a team of UQ and Dalian students, learning how to build a startup and collaborating with a group of six to develop our first web app. I discovered that Chinese food is amazing, the cities are enormous, and Australia could definitely benefit from promoting more fitness park dancing groups (they look really fun). Most importantly, I gained a deeper understanding of the challenges involved in creating an app that is useful, appropriate and accessible across multiple countries‚Äîsomething I hadn‚Äôt seriously considered until now.  Well, happy reflecting, everyone! I‚Äôm excited to see what‚Äôs in store for 2025.

name: COSCO SHIPPING Europe
text: Water transport routes can be a challenge:   Last week, we showed you how we delivered two container gantry cranes to the. üèóÔ∏èüèóÔ∏è  Because the arms of the gantry cranes have to be folded up for and space reasons in the Hamburg port area, this required an additional stop at Athabaskakai, very close to the final destination at the CTB 1-2 terminal.  üõë üöß 22 kilometres earlier, two high-voltage power lines cross the Elbe, limiting the maximum height for ship and cargo to 92.5 m, as can be seen in the photo. This made an earlier stop to lift the gantry cranes' arms impossible.  After they had arrived at Athabaskakai, it took about one working day per crane to lift the arms, as the welded joints and load securing devices had to be burnt off first. As the cranes were not yet connected to the terminal's power supply, their arms were lifted using the ship's own hydraulics.  üëâ Stay tuned for our next video and the final journey of the gantry cranes to CTB 1-2! name: David Underwood
text: When it comes to evaluating multi-component interventions, especially in areas like childhood obesity prevention, traditional methods often fall short. A recent model uses a refined approach to meta-regression, helping to identify which features of interventions, such as intensity or duration, are most effective.  By accounting for multi-arm, multi-follow-up trials, this method gives researchers a better understanding of which intervention characteristics drive success. It‚Äôs an important step forward for improving the design and effectiveness of public health strategies.  For those interested in the full details, check out the article:

name: Angelica Widstr√∂m
position: Legal Adviser at the Swedish Red Cross
text: I‚Äôm honored to have attended this year‚Äôs Bruges Colloquium on International Humanitarian Law, centered on the thought-provoking theme: ‚ÄúHumanity in War.‚Äù üåç‚öñÔ∏è  The colloquium served as a compelling reminder of IHL‚Äôs core purpose: safeguarding human dignity in times of armed conflict. The discussions seamlessly bridged timeless issues‚Äîsuch as states‚Äô responsibilities under GC Common Article 1 when exporting arms‚Äîwith emerging challenges like the use of artificial intelligence in targeting. These conversations provided invaluable insights for anyone engaged in the field.  Engaging with experts, practitioners, and academics was both inspiring and motivating. Events like this not only deepen our understanding of IHL but also reaffirm our shared commitment to upholding its principles, even in times when the international legal system is questioned as a whole.  Grateful for the opportunity to reflect on how we can ensure that humanity remains at the heart of conflict regulation and to bring these lessons back into my work.

text: Le SCAF s'gaffe, ou comment Papa Scholz et Sanchez de Plata mettent la choucroute et la paella dans le boeuf bourguignon SCAF pour en faire un gloubi-boulga.. Bien indigeste.. Autrement dit, la seule France avec une a√©ronavale, sans convaincre l'espagnol et le cousin germain de l'int√©r√™t de d√©velopper une a√©ronavale europ√©enne, ce qui est d√©j√† tr√®s cher et long √† acqu√©rir en exp√©rience et mat√©riel, hors porte-avions, alors que cor√©ens, japonais, Australiens, indon√©siens, turcs, canadiens, br√©siliens, argentins, italiens, russes, et indiens y viennent d√©j√† avec des porte-avions STOBAR.. Ou transforment leurs porte-h√©licopt√®res d'assaut en porte-avions d'assaut ou y viendront  Rappelons peut-√™tre que l'origine des r√©acteurs ATAR est fortement inspir√© des r√©acteurs allemands de la 2e G.M., que dans les entrailles d'Airbus reste les bribes de Messerschmitt et autres, et que l'ami britannique sur le European Combat Fighter a dit bye bye au fran√ßais Marcel Dassault, ayant pourtant une Fleet Air Arm.. √† l'√©poque sur AV8 Harrier.  Les allemands avaient des avions qui ont fait la course avec les russes et les alli√©s lors de la derni√®re guerre. Mais ils ont perdu. Ils voient √† raison l'industrie d'artillerie et de blind√©s fran√ßaise comme son industrie a√©ronautique comme un immense march√© de brevets √† piller.  On met tant√¥t l'ami espagnol, tant√¥t l'ami italien. Si on veut demain d√©velopper une a√©ronautique comme une a√©ronavale europ√©enne, comme une arme blind√©e europ√©enne et se d√©tacher du fournisseur am√©ricain, l'Europe doit cr√©er des g√©ants de l'armement capables de prendre les march√©s domestiques comme √† l'international.  Dans ce march√© europ√©en, avoir des Gripen navalises comme des A321 P8, des avions STOL meilleurs que les F35, comme des Leclerc ou L√©opard meilleurs que l'Armata T14 est une question de volont√©s, de ch√©quier et d'achat communs.  Combien de flottes de F35 en Europe, une dizaine. Le catalogue du mat√©riel polonais est am√©ricain et cor√©en sur √©tag√®re. Livr√©s vite, en masse et peu cher. Ce dont les europ√©ens ne sont plus capables. D√©j√† sur des produits de base comme l'obus.  A Verdun, en 10h, 1 million d'obus tout calibres ont √©t√© tir√©s,.. quand 110 ans plus tard, toute l'Europe est incapable d'en produire ce m√™me million en 1 an. name: Evelyn Ohiolei, AMPMA, CIPM, CCRM
position: Broadcast Journalist || Award Winning News Anchor/Presenter || Creative Writer || Mental Health Advocate || Communication Specialist || Media Consultant
text: 300 SECONDS AT THE STATE CID, OSOGBO.  Last week, I was at the NPF State CID, Osogbo, to receive a package.  As I walked towards the entrance, I had no idea that a simple errand would turn into a teachable moment. My contact, a sister and an officer, had promised to meet me at the entrance, so I waited patiently beside a small shelter close to the entrance.  Before long, a chorus of catcalls echoed from the officers stationed at the corner. 'Ehsss, leave that place, Oga dey call you,' one of them jeered. I turned, my anger simmering just below the surface. "Oga, you wouldn't appreciate it if I referred to you as "Ehh man..."' I retorted, my voice firm but respectful.   The officer (The Oga), taken aback by my assertiveness, beckoned me over and asked why I was angry.  'Oga, your men can do better. You can do better. The fact that you have your uniform on doesn't make you a superior human. Respect is reciprocal" I said firmly.  The officer nodded, taking my words to heart. He observed that I may have some relationship with an officer (because of how bold I was), so he apologized and asked for my mission in their base. Just then, my contact emerged, sensing the tension in the air. 'What happened?' she asked, her eyes scanning the scene. I downplayed the incident, but she wasn't satisfied. She asked her colleagues what had transpired, but they also (knowing what they did) dismissed the issue.  Probably knowing what her male colleagues are capable of doing, she decided to reveal my identity. 'That's Evelyn Ohiolei of RaveFM,' she announced proudly.  The atmosphere shifted instantly. The officers' demeanor changed from dismissive to deferential. 'Oh... so na she be this... I no know say you fine like this oo..' one of them exclaimed. I smiled, nodded, and collected my package.  As I walked away from the heavily guarded entrance, I couldn't help but overhear the officers' newfound respect for me. 'All these journalists sef...' one of them trailed off, their tone now laced with admiration. It was a small victory, but one that reminded me that, always I must stand up for myself and that respect is indeed reciprocal.  That may not be the case of another random lady who may be intimidated by the officer's uniform, baritone voices and arms. I hope our officers can understand that, citizens must be treated with respect and dignity.   Evelyn Ohiolei

name: 3D Printed Architecture
text: This Complex Concrete Column Was Made Using 3D-Printed Formwork. While large-scale 3D printing for architecture continues to be a busy area of research, France-based company XtreeE. 3d has been using 3D printed concrete in projects since 2015. Their latest creation is an organic truss-style support structure for a preschool playground in Aix-en-Provence.  To create the structure, XtreeE programmed an industrial robot arm to extrude a special mixture of concrete to form the "envelope," or outer layer, of the organic structure. The hollow envelope was then filled with LafargeHolcim concrete and filed to remove the appearance of each printed layer, creating a smooth surface that calls to mind the twisted roots of a tree  üì∏ Lisa Riciotti / XtreeE

name: Nakate Josephine
position: Ugandan Best Female biomedical Technician and CEO 3Digital marketing agency
text: Did you know every December 3rd, we shine a light on the International Day of Persons with Disabilities? As we celebrate, let's remember that every person deserves to be seen, heard, and empowered - regardless of their abilities.  Imagine a world where 15% of the population is marginalized, excluded, and overlooked. That's the reality for many people with disabilities. But what if we could change that narrative?  Let's create a world where:  Every workplace is a beacon of inclusion Every place of worship welcomes all with open arms Every educational institution unlocks the potential of every student. Every policy is designed with accessibility in mind Every infrastructure is built with equality at its core. And not forgetting every recreational place built with equality.  Least but not last , remember mental disabilities are just as real, and often self imposed . Many of us limit ourselves with insecurities that limit us and rob us of the bright future thats prepared for us.  However, with empathy, understanding, and self-awareness, we can break down barriers and unlock the full potential of every individual.  As we celebrate today, let's make a promise to ourselves and to each other:  We will be the champions of inclusion We will be the allies of the marginalized We will be the architects of a more compassionate world  Together, we can create a world where everyone can thrive.   credits: Below is a picture of Husnah Kukundakwe Uganda's Paralympian /Paraswimmer.

name: Luca Leone
text: The Government‚Äôs Manifesto stated that it would ‚Äúbring forward a defence industrial strategy aligning our security and economic priorities. We will ensure a strong defence sector and resilient supply chains, including steel, across the whole of the UK. We will establish long-term partnerships between business and government, promote innovation, and improve resilience. We will prioritise UK businesses for defence investment and will reform procurement to reduce waste. We will support industry to benefit from export opportunities, in line with a robust arms export regime committed to upholding international law.‚Äù  This Government is determined to deliver on this promise to British businesses and the British public. Therefore, the Government‚Äôs recent modern Industrial Strategy named defence as one of the eight priority sectors for economic growth. It stated that ‚ÄúDefence and national security are foundational for economic growth across the UK‚Äù and promised a Defence Industrial Strategy ‚Äúwill be commissioned by the Secretary of State for Defence and will be the sector plan for defence in the Industrial Strategy.‚Äù The Defence Industrial Strategy will help deliver the Industrial Strategy‚Äôs objectives to drive growth and support Net Zero, regional growth, and economic security and resilience.  This Statement of Intent outlines the approach and process the Ministry of Defence will follow in developing this new Defence Industrial Strategy. It is designed to send an early market signal to business to see the Government‚Äôs direction of travel, take advantage of new opportunities, partner with Government, and prepare for change.

name: CosmaGroup
text: üáÆüáπ All‚Äôinterno di una realt√† altamente innovativa come la nostra, per i prodotti a pi√π alta tiratura, l'automazione √® un must.   Nel video possiamo vedere alcune delle fasi principali della lavorazione eseguita dal braccio antropomorfo che abbiamo recentemente introdotto in azienda. L‚Äôimpianto √® in grado di eseguire autonomamente ogni passaggio: dal prelievo e posizionamento dei ripiani, all‚Äôestrazione dei pezzi dallo stampo, fino allo scarico delle materozze e dei componenti sull‚Äôorientatore e alla sistemazione finale nell‚Äôimballo.  Chiaramente il ruolo del nostro team resta fondamentale per supervisionare il processo e garantire la qualit√†. Questa √® un‚Äôulteriore dimostrazione di come l‚Äôunione della tecnologia alle capacit√† dei nostri collaboratori ci differenzi in un contesto in continua evoluzione.  üá¨üáß Within a highly innovative environment like ours, automation is a must for high-volume production.  In the video, we can see some of the main stages of the process carried out by the anthropomorphic robotic arm recently introduced in our company. The system autonomously performs every step: from picking and placing the shelves, extracting pieces from the mold, removing the sprues and components onto the orienter, to the final arrangement in the packaging.  Of course, our team‚Äôs role remains essential in supervising the process and ensuring quality. This is yet another demonstration of how combining advanced technology with the skills of our collaborators sets us apart in an ever-evolving context.
