text: VZW Rozemarijn üåø organiseert opvang en begeleiding voor volwassen personen met een handicap. 96 volwassenen zijn bij hen in begeleiding, verspreid over zes locaties in Keerbergen en Haacht.  Binnen de dagcentra worden zowel arbeidsgerichte als belevingsgerichte activiteiten op maat aangeboden. Ook is er woonondersteuning in leefgroepen mogelijk.  De visie van Rozemarijn VZW is 'Iedereen uniek, met hun eigen mogelijkheden en beperkingen'. Een warm netwerk en betrokken medewerkers zetten zich hiervoor dagelijks in. Bovendien is er een nauwe samenwerking met een paramedisch team dat bestaat uit artsen en kinesisten.  Om gerichte medische ondersteuning te bieden, wil Rozemarijn VZW volgend jaar investeren in een toestel dat de arm- en beenspieren kan versterken. Om dit dure toestel te bekostigen is elke gift van tel.  Stemmen via üëâ

name: Beatrice Njoka
position: Passionate Front End Developer | Crafting User-Centric Experiences | Empowering Brands with Engaging Interfaces | Trusted by Leading Tech Firms
text: ‚ú® Reflecting on My 2024 Milestones & Looking Ahead ‚ú®   As the year winds down, I can‚Äôt help but reflect on the incredible journey 2024 has been‚Äîa year filled with growth, challenges, and meaningful decisions that have shaped my path. Here are some highlights and lessons from my year:  üíª Starting the Year with Tecktick I kicked off 2024 as a Software Developer at Tecktick, diving into exciting projects that pushed me to refine my skills and deliver impactful solutions. This experience was pivotal in building my confidence and strengthening my foundation in software development.  üéì Transitioning to IT Support Mid-year, I embraced a new challenge as an IT Support Intern. It‚Äôs been a hands-on learning experience, from understanding infrastructure support and asset management to exploring the world of networking. Each day presents opportunities to grow, and I‚Äôve been lucky to work alongside an amazing team that makes learning even more fulfilling.  üöß Tackling Challenges in the Tech Industry The tech industry is fast-paced and demanding, and I‚Äôve certainly felt the weight of imposter syndrome at times. From questioning whether I belong to doubting my capabilities, there were moments of self-doubt. But through perseverance, mentorship, and leaning on my support system, I‚Äôve learned to recognize my worth and trust in my ability to learn and grow.  üìö Leveraging Resources for Growth Platforms like W3Schools, Scrimba, freeCodeCamp, and Coursera have been my constant companions this year. They‚Äôve helped me stay curious, upskill, and stay relevant in an ever-evolving tech landscape.  üöÄ A Big Decision One of the defining moments of my year was being offered a CTO role at a startup. While I was deeply honored by the opportunity, I chose to turn it down‚Äîfor now. I realized I still have so much to learn and experience before stepping into such a significant leadership position. For me, growth and preparation are key, and I‚Äôm excited to continue building the skills and knowledge that will one day make me ready for such a challenge.  üåü Looking Ahead to 2025 With just over a month to go, I‚Äôm excited to welcome 2025 with open arms. My goals include continuing to sharpen my skills, contributing to meaningful projects, and finding new ways to give back to the tech community.  To everyone who has been part of my journey this year‚Äîthank you. Your support, encouragement, and collaboration have made all the difference. Here‚Äôs to finishing 2024 strong and stepping boldly into a new year full of possibilities.  How has your year been? What are you looking forward to in 2025? Let‚Äôs celebrate our wins and set new goals together.

name: Rohini Anand PhD
position: Strategic DEI Advisor | Highly Sought-after Board Member | Published Author | Esteemed Speaker
text: ‚ÄúI‚Äôve had a wonderful life,‚Äù is how John D. Kemp, author of Disability Friendly and President and CEO of Lakeshore Foundation, started his conversation with me. Born missing most of his arms and legs and losing his mother when he was 15 months, John Kemp‚Äôs is a remarkable story of courage and resilience. A story that led him to play a key role as a disability advocate on the national and international stage.  Today on International Day of People with Disabilities, in his book John Kemp reminds us that people with disabilities make up at least 15% of the global population ‚Äì more than 1 billion people- and are an underutilized talent pool. He provides us with a blueprint that organizations can use to make their workplaces disability friendly so that they can recruit and retain people with disabilities. Disability friendly workplaces make for enhanced innovation, team work and productivity that benefit all.  In my conversations with John, he credits his father who lost his wife - the love of his life- at 32 years and dedicated his life to fulfil John‚Äôs mother‚Äôs wish that John be given every opportunity in life. His father always encouraged him to do whatever he wanted including John‚Äôs childhood aspiration to be a baseball star. And he conditioned John to be independent ‚Äì just as he did with John‚Äôs siblings. John described vividly his seven block walk to grade school in N Dakota in 20 degree below freezing weather and 2 feet of snow.  In addition to a roadmap for organizations to build an inclusive culture for people with disabilities, John narrates his lived experience with candor and humor. He became a student manager of a basketball team so he could vicariously fulfil his dream and went on to law school and was co-founder of the American association of People with Disabilities (AAPD).  John Kemp closed his conversation with me by quoting his father saying that everyone in the school will benefit by John being in their classroom- a great analogy for workplaces where entire teams benefit from the presence and inclusion of people with disabilities.  This International Day of People with Disabilities, I encourage you to be a disability ally and to read John‚Äôs book. As the endorsement says, Disability Friendly is a must read book for any twenty first century leader.  You can order the book here

name: Mor Hadasi - NisanüéóÔ∏è
text: Merck is looking for - Associate Director Real World Evidence (Oncology) All Genders üìçPosition is remote and can be located anywhere in the world  Your role: An exciting opportunity awaits you within the Patient Focused Real World Evidence (PRWE) Team for Oncology (Early Phase Development). As passionate leaders of patient focused real world data, evidence generation, and epidemiology, we are uniquely placed to enable fit-for-purpose visionary solutions. Our team operates with a proactive and agile approach, as a trusted partner in qualitative and quantitative sciences, all while striving towards the common goal to deliver more medicines to more patients faster. As a key member of our team, you will drive the Real-World Evidence and Data (RWE/D) strategy and studies, with a particular focus on early drug development and integrated evidence planning. You will provide scientific leadership and expertise to ensure that fit-for-purpose RWD are integrated in evidence generation plans and available to support program¬¥s decision-marking and regulatory submissions. You will lead the design, implementation and oversight of disease or drug-specific RWE studies, encompassing regulatory grade studies, i.e. safety related studies, external control arm studies and natural history of disease studies. Your work will involve inspiring cross-functional collaboration, in a unique partnership with other quantitative scientists while also maintaining and expanding our external collaborations.  Who you are: Background in health and life sciences (epidemiology, public health, MD, pharm D), or quantitative data sciences, biostatistics Doctoral and/or master‚Äôs degree (e.g., PhD, MSc) in Epidemiology, Public Health or related field Strong experience in RWE/D within the pharmaceutical industry, particularly in the application of RWE in drug development for rare indications and early phase development Prior experience in supporting the therapeutic area of Oncology Demonstrable experience in leading RWE generation plans and studies end-to end, including application of innovative designs and methods Excellent oral and written communication skills and demonstrated ability to engage and communicate scientific evidence to peers and at scientific meetings Collaborative, proactive working style, with ability to work independently  For more information and to apply -

name: Raj Arora
position: Law Enforcement, Decorated and Honored with the President Police Medal for Meritorious Service. National Security and Law Enforcement. Innovation and Technologies Implementation. Cyber Security. Rotary Peace Fellow.
text: Drone Threats to Border Security  The rise of drone incursions has become a severe challenge to border security, especially with the use of drones for dropping weapons and contraband. A recent incident in Jaisalmer on Nov 30 saw the Border Security Force (BSF) successfully intercepting a drone carrying weapons. This is a growing concern, as drones are increasingly used by adversaries to bypass traditional security measures. To counter this threat, BSF has implemented a DDZ (Drone Dropping Zone) identification strategy, along with manning and domination operations during both day and night along the borders. These proactive measures ensure heightened vigilance and control over vulnerable zones.  pc-respective owner.

text: Amazon Web Services (AWS) is revolutionizing machine learning infrastructure with our latest innovations at  hashtag #AWSreInvent 2024! The custom Arm-based chips can deliver up to 40% better price performance for cloud workloads compared to x86 instances. text: Welcome to "The Lighter Side of Lab Leadership", a series where we tackle the serious decisions lab leaders face‚Äîwith a dash of humor and a healthy dose of insight.  In this installment, we step into one of the most heated (and often hilarious) debates in laboratory informatics: Customization vs. Configuration. It‚Äôs the classic clash of two philosophies: one side demands flexibility and uniqueness at any cost, while the other champions simplicity, speed, and standardization.  If you‚Äôve ever found yourself trapped in the middle of this argument, wondering whether you‚Äôre investing in a lab system or starring in a reality show, this article is for you. We‚Äôll explore both sides of the debate, share real-world scenarios, and arm you with the insights needed to steer your team toward the best decision‚Äîwhile keeping your sanity intact. Because let‚Äôs face it, running a lab isn‚Äôt just about data; it‚Äôs also about navigating personalities, priorities, and (sometimes) passionate disagreements. Let‚Äôs dive in!

text: üîß Boost Operator Safety and Ergonomics with Chicago Pneumatic's Low Vibration Tooling! üîß  Did you know that prolonged exposure to hand-arm vibration (HAV) can lead to serious health issues like Hand-Arm Vibration Syndrome (HAVS)? This condition can cause permanent damage to nerves, blood vessels, muscles, and joints in the hands and arms. üòü  At, we prioritize operator safety and ergonomics. Our low vibration tools are designed to significantly reduce the risk of HAVS, ensuring a safer and more comfortable working environment. Here‚Äôs how:  ‚úÖ Reduced Vibration Levels: Our tools are engineered to minimize vibration, reducing the strain on operators' hands and arms. ‚úÖ Enhanced Comfort: Ergonomically designed handles and grips provide better control and comfort, allowing operators to work longer with less fatigue. ‚úÖ Increased Productivity: With less vibration and more comfort, operators can maintain higher productivity levels without compromising their health. ‚úÖ Compliance with Safety Standards: Our tools meet and exceed industry safety standards, giving you peace of mind that your team is protected. name: Physio360Chennai
text: üëâWalking is an essential activity; however, numerous individuals inadvertently employ incorrect techniques that may result in discomfort, inefficiency, or even injury. Here are some guidelines to help you walk correctly.  1. Maintain an upright posture by keeping your head elevated and directed forward, rather than looking downward. Ensure that your shoulders are relaxed and positioned slightly back to prevent any hunching. Engage your core muscles to provide support for your lower back.  2. Arm Movement: Permit your arms to move freely in coordination with your walking pace. Flex your elbows to a 90-degree angle to enhance the intensity of your walk. Refrain from crossing your arms in front of your torso.  3. Foot Placement: Initiate contact with the ground using your heel, subsequently rolling through the foot to propel yourself off with your toes. It is advisable to refrain from stomping or over-striding, as these actions may lead to joint strain.  4. Gait: Ensure that your stride length remains natural; avoid taking excessively long or short steps. Your movements should exhibit a smooth and rhythmic quality.  5.Inhale deeply and maintain a steady rhythm, coordinating your breathing with your movements whenever feasible. Refrain from taking shallow or quick breaths.  ‚ú¥Ô∏èCommon Walking Errors to Avoid 1‚É£Poor Posture: Causes additional strain on the spine and surrounding muscles.  2‚É£Constantly Looking Down: Can lead to neck strain and diminish awareness of your environment.  3‚É£Excessive Striding: Results in inefficiency and increased stress on the joints.  4‚É£Shuffling Feet: May indicate muscle weakness or fatigue.  5‚É£Disregarding Discomfort: Pain experienced while walking could indicate improper form or other underlying problems.  Physio360 awareness, frequently linked to mindful or therapeutic walking, highlights the importance of maintaining correct posture, understanding movement mechanics, and practicing mindfulness during walking. This methodology is especially beneficial for enhancing physical health and aiding in injury rehabilitation. Below are the advantages of walking with Physio360 awareness for your body.

text: This üëáüèΩ speaks for itself. The collective west via NATO cannot keep up with Russia‚Äôs military production capacity.  The supposed Kellogg Plan to pressure Russia and Ukraine to a ceasefire and a negotiation presupposes a stalemate environment, and an assessment from al belligerents that this is the state of affairs. It‚Äôs not and few serious analysts believe that the NATO-backed Ukrainians can change the tide of the war.  The Kellogg ambit is further premised on the threat (made by Trump) that the U.S. will increase its support to Ukraine unless Russia comes to the table. This is not a realistic threat. Russia has clear escalation ascendency with the Oreshnik hypersonic glide vehicle, coupled with overwhelming volume advantages in conventional armaments (main story below).  The Kellogg proposal apparently also involves a trade off of land for ‚Äúpeace‚Äù with NATO membership agreed but deferred for 10 years (while the west beefs up the Ukrainian military). This is unlikely to be a starter, given that one of the original objectives spelled out by Putin was the ensure Ukrainian neutrality.

name: Pascal Hetzscholdt
position: Senior Director, Content Protection at Wiley
text: Quote: "Silicon Valley tech giants, including Microsoft and Google, have supported tech companies that provide censorship and policing technologies in China, according to publicly available corporate and promotional materials reviewed by Rest of World. Support for the companies through their startup incubator programs raises questions about the future of these initiatives, especially as Donald Trump prepares to take a second term as president. (...) Over the last decade, China has become a global leader in using new technologies for surveillance and policing. In some cases, the technology enforces traffic rules and finds missing children. But authorities also use cutting-edge software to censor online speech, arrest bloggers and activists, and surveil ethnic minorities, most notably the Uyghur population in the northwestern region of Xinjiang. Two Chinese companies were selling censorship software to support government regulations or working with the police before they joined Microsoft‚Äôs long-running program. AI startup Data Grand sold censorship software to internet companies before joining the incubator in 2017, while cybersecurity firm Tophant partnered with a police research institute back in 2021, before it was accepted into the program in 2023. Two other startups partnered with Chinese police after they graduated from the U.S. tech giant‚Äôs program. In 2018, facial recognition firm DeepGlint worked closely with police in Xinjiang, where the government deployed surveillance tools to oppress ethnic minorities. In 2021, the U.S. sanctioned DeepGlint for its involvement in human rights violations in Xinjiang. Another company, Hydata, collaborated with a police lab in Xinjiang in charge of analyzing surveillance camera footage. The incubator program, called ‚ÄúMicrosoft for Startups,‚Äù has supported more than 800 companies since its launch in China in 2012, according to Microsoft‚Äôs website. The program provides office space, mentorship opportunities, access to Microsoft tools and cloud computing and connects firms with investors and clients. Several U.S. tech companies have introduced similar incubator programs in China to find business partners and expand their own client base in a fast-growing tech industry. (...) Google, Nvidia, and Amazon Web Services ‚Äî Amazon‚Äôs cloud computing arm ‚Äî also run incubation programs in China. Rest of World found documentation, including press releases and media coverage, which showed that one startup supported by Google, LLVision, was providing smart glasses that helped police identify fugitives for several years before joining Google‚Äôs incubator in 2022. Microsoft did not respond to Rest of World‚Äôs requests for comment, and Google declined to comment." More details:

name: Colm Dougan
text: Clay smoking pipes, Thames River finds.   Clay pipes are some of the most interesting objects found on the Thames foreshore in London. Although the pipes are made of thin, fragile clay, the soft Thames mud has protected many of them for centuries.  In the late 16th century, the price of tobacco in London was very expensive as only small quantities of tobacco were imported into the country at that time. Only wealthy individuals could afford to smoke, and the clay pipe bowls were therefore very small. As the imports increased, the price of tobacco dropped, and common people could afford to smoke. The size of the pipe bowls increased steadily through the 17th and 18th centuries as the price of tobacco sank due to increased tobacco production and well-established trade routes to the American colonies.  Considered to be the cigarettes of their day, clay pipes were often pre-filled with tobacco and sold by shops for a single use before they were discarded. It is no wonder that thousands of clay pipes are still found along the Thames foreshore where workers would smoke as they went about their business. The locations of the busiest ports in Georgian and Victorian London can still easily be identified by the number of clay pipe stems and bowls which litter the Thames foreshore to this day.  In the 16th and 17th centuries, clay pipes were mostly undecorated, but in the mid-18th century, clay pipe makers began to use molds with decorative designs. Based on the Royal Coat of Arms of the British monarchy, an English lion and Scottish unicorn were often depicted on opposite sides of the clay pipe bowls made in London between 1730-1770.  Source:

name: Maciek Mysliwiec
text: Today, the name and a patch of the Polish Mission to ISS were announced. Here it is. The mission name will be IGNIS! Polish Astronaut Slawosz Uznanski is now training for AX-4 mission.  Ignis in Latin means "fire." This is the name chosen for a mission dedicated to igniting the Polish space sector. Ignis is a technological and scientific mission. As part of it, S≈Çawosz Uzna≈Ñski, a Polish ESA project astronaut, will conduct a series of experiments proposed by experts from Poland's space industry and science sectors, developed in collaboration with ESA. The central element of the mission patch is a white and red eagle, directly referencing Poland's coat of arms and national colors. The eagle's outstretched wings form the contours of the Tatra Mountains, specifically the Orla Perƒá (Eagle's Path). The shape of the eagle's tail resembles a flame. In the mission name, "Ignis," the second "i" is stylized as the International Space Station. Above it, the stars form the constellation Scutum Sobiescianum (Sobieski's Shield), paying tribute to both Polish heritage and the renowned Gda≈Ñsk astronomer Johannes Hevelius (1611‚Äì1687). The silver line at the top of the patch symbolizes the horizon ‚Äì the dawn of a new era in space exploration.

name: Dr. Christoph Guger
position: Founder & CEO @ g.tec medical engineering GmbH | BCI | Neurotechnology
text: After only 18 hours of work. Before and after recoveriX üòçüòç. g.tec's neurorehabilitation solution draws on 25 years of expertise in Brain-Computer Interface (BCI) technology. These achievements have been made possible by recoveriX, a neurorehabilitation system designed for stroke, multiple sclerosis (MS), and Parkinson's patients. The system is medically certified, safe, and effective, and is currently used in more than 20 countries worldwide. Patients are required to imagine motor movements 6,000 to 8,000 times. The BCI system is capable of detecting these imagined movements in real-time and triggers functional electrical stimulation in the hand or foot. This reconnects cognitive functions with motor functions, allowing patients to regain movement in their hands/arms and feet/legs. Remarkably, this therapy can be effective even 10, 20, or 30 years after a stroke or the onset of MS or Parkinson's. It is never too late to begin treatment. The joy on a patient's face when a paralyzed hand suddenly moves again is truly unforgettable.  üëâPlease get in contact with us if you are interested in the therapy: üëâTo learn more about recoveriX, visit: üëâTo request a recoveriX system quote or to get pricing information, visit: üëâTo see other pre- and post-videos: üëâTo read about study results: üëâTo read more about recoveriX in Forbes, visit:

name: Jason Ingham
position: Recovering addict offering experience / strength and hope to the still suffering . Public speaking / Author . 30 years in construction management
text: Good morning to you all .   Hope your well and enjoying life to the full.   Todays reading is ( A vision without limits )  In addiction the only vision we see is the end of our fix , bottle and where to get the next 1 .  Everyday in my darkest days were the same the vision each day like ground hog day .  In our active addiction out vision becomes so blurred the only vision I had left was wanting to Die .  Today it‚Äôs not like that .  I do have a vision but if I‚Äôm being honest it‚Äôs for 24 hours and recovery .  Yes I have hopes for my future and not if but when they happen I will accept with open arms .  December 3 Vision without limits Perhaps for the first time, we see a vision of our new life.  Basic Text, p. 35  =  In our addiction, our vision of ourselves was very limited. Each day, we went through the same routine: getting, using, and finding ways and means to get more. And thats all we could reasonably expect for the duration of our lives. Our potential was limited.  Today, our prospects are changed. Recovery has given us a new vision of ourselves and our lives. We are no longer trapped in the endlessly gray routine of addiction. We are free to stretch ourselves in new ways, trying out new ideas and new activities. In doing so, we come to see ourselves in a new way. Our potential is limited only by the strength of the Higher Power that cares for usand that strength has no limits.  In recovery, life and everything in it appears open to us. Guided by our spiritual principles, driven by the power given us by the God of our understanding, our horizons are limitless.  =  Just for today: I will open my eyes to the possibilities before me. My potential is as limitless and as powerful as the God of my understanding. Today, I will act on that potential.  ‚ù§Ô∏èüôèüí™. Jay

name: Umbrella Yoga CIC
text: üßòüèº üçÇ Move More Monday's are here to warm & sustain you!  üßò üå∞ Feeling a bit stuck in the proverbial mud is a common part of the seasonal shift for many of us as we move into Winter.  üßòüèæ üçÅ Introducing: Matkuna Shavasana- aka Dead Bug pose!  -Floor-based (supine) posture that strengthens limbs, core, and spinal muscles. -Beginners-Level friendly, deeply relaxing and strengthening.  How to:  1) Lie on the mat with your arms extended straight up to form a perpendicular angle with your torso. 2) Bend your hips and knees 90 degrees, lifting your feet from the ground. Your torso and thighs should form a right angle, as should your thighs and shins. This is the starting position. 3) Engage your core, maintaining contact between your lower back and the mat. You want your spine to maintain this steady, neutral position throughout the exercise. 4) Keep your right arm and left leg exactly where they are, then slowly reach your left arm backward, over your head, and toward the floor as you simultaneously extend your right knee and hip, reaching your right heel toward the floor. 5) Move slowly and steadily, breathing in as you perform the extensions, avoiding twisting or moving your hips and abs. Stop the movement just before your arm and leg touch the ground. 6) Reverse the movement and return your left arm and right leg to their starting positions. Move slowly and steadily, exhaling as you go. 7)Perform the same movements to the opposite sides, keeping your left arm and right leg steady as you extend your right arm and left leg. 8) Do the same number of repetitions on each side. When you complete a full set, return your feet to the ground and sit up.

name: Theo Dyer
position: Geopolitics and International Affairs MA graduate
text: Syria: Rebel Resurgence and Proxy Conflict  This week the Syrian rebel groups Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS) and the Syrian National Army (SNA) began an offensive towards Aleppo and the surrounding areas. Why have HTS and the SNA succeeded in pushing back government (Syrian Arab Army/ SAA) forces and what are the potential explanations for their actions?  HTS split from al-Qaeda in 2016 and took control over Idlib in northwestern Syria. The Islamist group governs part of Idlib province and has tried destroy ISIS and other fundamentalists on its territory. The SNA is a coalition of rebel militias trained by T√ºrkiye which control land along the north-western Turkish-Syrian border.  The offensive has taken land in Aleppo, Idlib and Hama provinces and severed the M5 Damascus-Aleppo highway. This was possible because of Syria‚Äôs decline into a theatre for regional competition. Bashar al-Assad‚Äôs weakened SAA only controls two thirds of Syria. The economic collapse and sectarian violence caused by the Syrian Civil War have destroyed the state‚Äôs capacity to govern its territory.  Iran has supported Assad with arms, money and the presence of the Iranian Revolutionary Guards Quds Force since 2011. This intervention protected Assad and Iranian supply routes to Lebanon. Iranian and Hezbollah support was crucial to SAA counterattacks against rebels and ISIS. However, the 2024 Israeli-Lebanese conflict left Assad vulnerable by weakening Hezbollah and distracting Iran.  Russia has supported the SAA with airstrikes, as it has done since its intervention in 2015, but the renewal of conflict in 2024 has seen Russian troops retreat from the advancing rebels. This may have been motivated by the constraints placed on Russian resources by the Russo-Ukrainian war. Russia‚Äôs priority is protecting its bases in Tartus and Latakia, which are vital to its Mediterranean naval presence and African logistics routes.  T√ºrkiye has the greatest role in the renewal of hostilities. It organises and arms the SNA and has allowed HTS to exist on the Turkish border. The Turkish army operates outposts in both SNA and HTS territory, with the rebel offensive not being possible without Turkish permission or covert support. T√ºrkiye has previously intervened in Syria to repel the primarily Kurdish SDF from its border, preventing cooperation between Turkish and Syrian Kurdish militias.  T√ºrkiye‚Äôs potential covert support for the rebel offensive could be to drive the SDF and SAA away from the border and resettle Syrian refugees from T√ºrkiye to rebel controlled areas. Repopulating the Syrian border areas with Syrian Arabs would undermine Kurdish separatists inside T√ºrkiye, who want to establish a greater Kurdistan in this region. The offensives also pressure Assad, who during Turkish-Syrian normalisation talks has refused to make concessions such as the return of Syrian refugees or cessation of support for the captagon drug trade.

name: Huw Slater
text: Performance reviews cost companies a boatload üí∏ Is it worth it? Or just a relic of the past.  Despite best intentions and a lot of effort, results often disappoint. Let's reassess:  Typical scorecard: ‚úÖ Process documented and followed (with lots of arm twisting and a fancy SaaS tool) ‚úÖ Employee Performance measured (well, kind of...) ‚ùå Actual improvement  Why do we keep going with an ineffective system?  Can we use the time and money elsewhere to get actual performance improvements?  Who's cracked the code?  Share your success stories or challenges below. Let's learn from each other's experiences and build better practices together. üí°

name: Benjamin Owen
position: Personal and Professional Coach at Coach Benjamin Owen
text: You can‚Äôt fake Congruenceüëáüèº  I could never challenge my staff on being late, Until I started being on time myself.  I couldn‚Äôt really help someone get really clear on what they really wanted, Until I worked on this myself.  I used to get so frustrated when I couldn‚Äôt hold someone to a standard I wasn‚Äôt keeping to myself.  I learned that I could truly NEVER go ALL IN with someone in a place where I had big gaps in my leadership.  Honestly in my 15 years of leadership and coaching  I‚Äôve had to work behind the scenes continuously closing gaps on how I show up behind the curtain‚Ä¶  So I can show up powerfully in front of it.  This speaks not just about me,  It speaks to the experience I‚Äôve had coaching so many leaders.  They‚Äôve wanted to see external shifts,  But behind the scenes,  ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs Chaos‚Äù ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a ‚Äúsh*t show‚Äù ‚Üê their words not mine ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs so outta integrity‚Äù ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not taking my own medicine‚Äù  And this is where a RUSH of imposter syndrome shows up‚Ä¶  The little voice saying  ‚ÄúHow can you teach clients/ customers to do this when you don‚Äôt even do it yourself‚Ä¶ you fraud‚Äù  Every time I‚Äôd go to risk big,  There was this fear that someone was going to see behind the curtain.  So to hide this  I‚Äôd play a smaller game than I‚Äôd know is possible. I‚Äôd not go ALL IN. I‚Äôd make up BS stories about how I couldn‚Äôt close these gaps, that my situation was unique  Until I hired one of the best coaches in the world.  Who saw through my BS like an X-ray. Who‚Äôd hold up a mirror to all of the gaps, And who‚Äôd prescribe me work to go and close them.  I remember how transformational it was (And still is)  I became different.  I created my life differently and OWNED my choices.  Instead of constantly blaming anything I could.  Which in the long term only caused my problems to perpetuate.  Closing these gaps made my confidence skyrocket.  It‚Äôs been my life‚Äôs work helping folks who want the same.  Folks who are FED UP of the same problems or blocks getting in their way.  Folks who want someone in their corner to hold a mirror to their standards.  Who can give them a kind arm round the shoulder and a boot up the backside in the same moment.  Because I know how BIG the ripple effect is when a leader closes the gaps.  When the leader of a household, business, group or team leads at their best.  MAGIC happens. Their CREDIBILITY skyrockets. And the people they serve get the best version of them.  This is why I‚Äôm partnering with 3 people in December.  I want to help YOU map out what's possible & what gaps need to be closed.  Will it be easy - Depends Will it be pain free - No But will it be transformational‚Ä¶ YES  If you‚Äôre interested in one of the 2 spaces left in December where we‚Äôll work together on your Vision & Strategy,  Whilst removing the blocks that have stopped you in the past.  DM - LEADERSHIP to get the details.  Before I sign off‚Ä¶  It‚Äôs IN the closing of these gaps is where the magic happens.  And the truth is‚Ä¶ you can‚Äôt fake this type of leadership! ü§úüèºü§õüèº

name: Thenuka Shashindra Perera
position: Automation and Robotics Engineering Technology Undergraduate | B.Tech(Hons) | University of Kelaniya
text: üöÄ Revolutionizing Inventory Management: My Final Year Project at the University of Kelaniya  I'm excited to showcase the working prototype of my capstone project:  "Improving Inventory Management with PLC-Based Smart Vending Machines and Robotic Arm Mechanisms."  üéØ Key Highlights:  üîπ Objective: Automating the distribution of tools and materials through a PLC-controlled vending system, featuring a robotic arm and user-friendly HMI interface. üîπ Design: Integrated NEMA17 stepper motors, DC linear actuators, and an electromagnet for precise tool handling. üîπ Innovation: Developed a simulated HMI for seamless user interaction and inventory tracking. üîπ Results: Achieved a remarkable 90% accuracy in tool retrieval, reducing manual errors and improving operational efficiency.  üîß Future Enhancements:  1Ô∏è‚É£ Real-time inventory tracking for dynamic updates. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Physical HMI integration for better user experience. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Scalability for larger industrial applications.  This project was a fulfilling experience in combining mechanical design, electronics, and ladder programming on GX Developer to tackle real-world industrial challenges.   A heartfelt thanks to my supervisor, Dr. (Mrs.), for her invaluable guidance. Looking forward to contributing further in the fields of automation and robotics!  üí° Your thoughts and feedback are most welcome! üåü

name: Rossella Russo
position: Creator of transformative Journeys and Coliving experiences for Remote and Creative Professionals.
text: üßö I believe in meaningful coincidences.  My mum‚Äôs house in Sicily stayed unsold for years despite the fantastic location, the stunning sea view and the beautiful space.  My mother‚Äôs name was Giovanna, and she died at young age, just after moving in the house of her dreams. The house she had worked so hard to build.  There was something unaccomplished.  Until the day came.  When I was at the notary to sell the house of my mom, after 44 years, I could not believe my eyes.  The young and beautiful young lady who wanted to buy the house of Giovanna was another Giovanna.  Exactly like her, holding a child in her arms, like the child I was when my mom moved in.  ‚ú®It was like looping the loop‚ú®  I believe that houses whisper secrets, that they have a heart and a soul.  This house had just opened the arms as a person and the sun coming through the windows was just as if my mom was smiling and approving this transmission.  I now can imagine the new Life shining in this beautiful home, the children playing and laughing, exactly as she had wished.  - And you, do you have a coincidence that stroke you in your life? - Or the feeling that everything came to the best possible conclusion, in the end?  ‚ú®If yes, I‚Äôd love you to share it in the comments! ‚úçÔ∏è  - - -  For those who do not know me, I am Rossella, creator of Nomad Quests.  ‚ú®My purpose is to boost a new life into people and places‚ú®  I craft revitalising Journeys for location-independent professionals, corporate employees, creators, artists, and anyone who needs a fresh start.  üîó discover my website and activities in the comments!

name: Brian Holliday
position: I bring about a deeper awareness of mind, body and the present moment to enable my clients to effect real, long-lasting change in their chosen activity e.g. swimming | Virtual Coaching & Online Course #waterwellbeing
text: ùóüùó∂ùó∫ùó∂ùòÅùó∂ùóªùó¥ ùóïùó≤ùóπùó∂ùó≤ùó≥  Swimming is Boring!  You swim length after length at the same pace, daydreaming as you swim so you don't even notice you're actually swimming.  ùó°ùó≤ùòÑ ùóïùó≤ùóπùó∂ùó≤ùó≥  It's not swimming that is boring.  It's your thinking that makes it boring!  Any activity that you perform in the same way over and over will seem monotonous.   ùóñùóµùóÆùóπùóπùó≤ùóªùó¥ùó≤  Why not change your inner monologue by being mindful? - that is to say have a mind FULL of the feedback from your swimming  What can you notice to bring into your conscious awareness?  Notice:  the contact with the water your movement your momentum the noises from your swimming the noises in the pool the smell of chlorine the bubbles as your arm enters the glide the width of your vision during your glide  Enjoy the: feel of the water power from your stroke support from the water connection with the water speed the sense of calm during your glide  Choosing what occupies your awareness and attention is using Conscious Control to build your Unified Field of Attention/Awareness.  ùó¶ùóºùóπùòÇùòÅùó∂ùóºùóª  Learn to Live Every Stroke and develop Whole Body Movement Awareness to transform your thinking during your swimming.  Outcome  Swimming is a joy.    @mattdavies

text: Besonders wundert mich, dass Frau Neubauer sich sehr stark macht dass Deutschland 2045 klimaneutral sein muss. Es schaffen zu wollen ist ja ok.  Und fliegt gleichzeitig 11.000 km nach Bali, um sich zu entspannen. Nur ein Segelflugzeug schafft das nicht.  Ja nicht alle Lichter sind ausgegangen, aber ganz viele.  Ja Klimaschutz ist sehr wichtig. Aber er muss clever gemacht werden. Und da sind wir noch gar nicht auf dem Weg.  Und was w√ºrde dagegen sprechen, die bestehenden Atomkraftwerke weiter laufen zu lassen. Nat√ºrlich nur, wenn sie sicher sind. Denn es w√ºrden ja nur die Grenzkosten entstehen, denn Bau und Entsorgung sind ja bereits eingerechnet.  Mich w√ºrde mal interessieren, was ausser Kritik hat den Frau Neubauer f√ºr unser Land sonst geleistet?  Und arm sieht sie nicht gerade aus.

name: BS Immigration
text: Unlocking Opportunities: The UK Global Talent Visa üîì  Are you a professional at the top of your game? The UK is actively seeking exceptional individuals like you to contribute to its vibrant economy and culture. Let's explore the Global Talent Visa and see if it's your ticket to success in the United Kingdom.  Who Qualifies?  This visa isn't just for one type of professional. Whether you're a groundbreaking scientist, a visionary artist, or a tech innovator, there's a place for you. The key? Demonstrating exceptional achievements or potential in your field.  The Application Process:  1Ô∏è‚É£ Secure an endorsement from a recognised UK body 2Ô∏è‚É£ Submit your visa application It's worth noting that the process can take anywhere from a few weeks to several months, but with a 75% approval rate in 2023, the odds are in your favour!  Benefits That Make a Difference:  ‚Ä¢ Live and work in the UK for up to 5 years ‚Ä¢ Freedom to change employers or start your own business ‚Ä¢ Potential pathway to permanent residency  Career Prospects:  The UK job market welcomes Global Talent Visa holders with open arms. An impressive 95% find employment in their field of expertise, with salaries ranging from ¬£31,200 to ¬£51,999 annually. Even better, 99% report that their UK jobs align perfectly with their skills and experience.  Maximise Your Chances:  ‚Ä¢ Craft a compelling portfolio of achievements ‚Ä¢ Secure recommendations from industry experts ‚Ä¢ Clearly articulate how your work will benefit the UK  The Global Talent Visa isn't just a work permit; it's an opportunity to elevate your career on an international stage. If you believe you have what it takes, don't hesitate to explore this exciting path!  Read the full article on our website:

name: Humans of Bombay
text: What would you do if you fell from a moving train and suffered an injury so severe that your arm had to be amputated? It‚Äôs a thought most of us can‚Äôt even begin to imagine.  But for Ajeet Singh Yadav, this unimaginable tragedy became the starting point of an extraordinary journey.  Seven years after the accident that changed his life forever, Ajeet now proudly represents India on the global stage in Para Athletics. His resilience and grit have earned him a collection of medals, including a historic silver in javelin throw at the Paris Paralympics this year.  What makes Ajeet Singh Yadav stand out? How does one rise above such a devastating setback to bring not just personal glory but immense pride to an entire nation? Here's how this Paralympian redefined limits:

name: Mariusz GƒÖsiewski
position: CEE Mobile Gaming and Apps Lead @ Google | "Insight guy" | Investor
text: "Why is it so bad when it's so good?" It is the question I get often when I talk with the enthusiasm about opportunities in the mobile gaming, apps industry. Especially in the CEE region where many people reminisce with nostalgia easier times. There are many new challenges in the industry.  At the same time it seems to me that many people in those industries forgot about following: ‚ñ™Ô∏è gaming, apps (and actually whole Tech) is "high risk, high reward" business - many founders, investors forget the business they are in; you cannot grow in those industries having a high risk aversion ‚ñ™Ô∏è revenue is concentrated at the top. Only the best achieve significant success. Intense competition demands continuous learning and improvement. ‚ñ™Ô∏è once you are starting from a lower level, the only way to catch up is to work harder and risk more...  Seems to me people who have that in mind, feel much better in those industries. It is tempting to avoid risk: make another puzzle game (similar to many existing already), trying to look for easy investment etc. It rarely works in that business.  ùêèùêûùê´ùê¨ùê®ùêßùêöùê• ùê©ùêûùê´ùê¨ùê©ùêûùêúùê≠ùê¢ùêØùêû I've learned that the great progress comes from taking risks, working hard: ‚ñ™Ô∏è at the age of 9 I had serious car accident. The choice: easy (cut the whole arm) or hard (many months of painful treatment with no guarantee of success). Luckily it worked. ‚ñ™Ô∏è I was born in poor family - choice: easy (passiveness) or hard (constant learning, work during high school, competing with people who were much ahead of me). I ended up in the best economics university in the country. ‚ñ™Ô∏è I saw a computer for the first time in year 2000 at the university (we had none in my village, my previous schools) - I worked hard to learn; 3 years later I worked with Unix servers, 6 years later I had one of most popular blogs about Search Engine Marketing in PL, 7 years later I was starting job at Google in Poland as one of its first employees. ‚ñ™Ô∏è when I went to US as the student for the first time (my first flight ever), I hardly spoke English, our contract was a scam, had enough cash to survive for short time. With a last money we decided to buy a car, push more - luckily worked again.  ùêàùêßùêØùêûùê¨ùê≠ùê¶ùêûùêßùê≠ ùê©ùêûùê´ùê¨ùê©ùêûùêúùê≠ùê¢ùêØùêû ‚ñ™Ô∏è I invest in some startups as the Angel (investing significant part of my revenue - risky, although rewarding). I am trying to invest into people who are hard working, ambitious, not avoiding risk. My investment philosophy is to be a fighter investing in fighters. Majority of those startups are doing really well; those who are bold, persistent are doing best.  ùêÅùêÆùê¨ùê¢ùêßùêûùê¨ùê¨ ùê©ùêûùê´ùê¨ùê©ùêûùêúùê≠ùê¢ùêØùêû ‚ñ™Ô∏è At Google I worked with many top companies (advising big Google clients in Gaming, iGaming, Forex, Tech), startups (at the team looking for best startups). Companies that were growing the culture of risk taking, constant improvement (even for the price of temporary loss ) were doing much better in the long term.

name: WellPro‚Ñ¢
text: Compression Therapy: Your Solution for Soreness, Swelling, and Recovery  Do you ever struggle with tired, achy legs, post-workout soreness, poor circulation, or swelling after long days on your feet?  Compression therapy might be your answer! Research highlights its benefits in managing circulation and recovery, including:  - Improved blood flow (especially in the lower body) - Reduced swelling and fatigue after prolonged sitting or standing - Enhanced recovery after exercise - Relief from venous insufficiency (when veins struggle to send blood back to the heart)  Why It Works:  - Compression therapy applies controlled pressure to your limbs, helping to: - Counteract gravity and improve venous return (helping blood flow back to your heart) - Activate your natural "muscle pump" system (where muscles squeeze veins to promote circulation) - Reduce fluid buildup in tissues through gentle, consistent pressure  Modern Methods:  - Medical-grade compression stockings - Advanced pneumatic compression boots and sleeves - Professional treatments at wellness studios - Multi-layer systems for different types of conditions  Getting Started Safely:  - Pressure levels vary by need and device: - Regular use: 20‚Äì40 mmHg - Advanced therapy: up to 110 mmHg (pressure varies for legs, arms, or other areas) - Start with one session to see how your body responds - Avoid if you have severe arterial disease or open infections - Consult with a healthcare professional before starting  Compression therapy could be exactly what your body needs for improved circulation, faster recovery, and long-term wellness!

name: Tom Chaldecott
text: The trap key system is a clever safety mechanism that ensures safe access to hazardous areas of machinery. I recently showcased their functionality in a demonstration you can find on YouTube.  Imagine a machine in operation, indicated by a green light. To safely access the inside, you: 1. Turn and remove the key from the barrel, which isolates the machine (the green light goes off). 2. Insert the key into a secondary barrel, turning it to release a trapped key. 3. Push down a safety arm to ensure the key isn‚Äôt left in place unintentionally. 4. Use the trapped key to unlock and open the guard, safely accessing the machine.  This system ensures that the machine cannot be restarted while someone is inside, as it cannot operate without the key returned to its initial position. After maintenance, you reverse the process to restart the machine safely.  Trap key systems are an excellent example of fail-safe design, preventing accidents by controlling the sequence of operations. They provide peace of mind that safety protocols are enforced mechanically, not just procedurally.    Credit toand theteam.

text: Did you know that Kawasaki Robotics robots have built-in arm digital input and output signals?  ARM ID is an electronic board in the robot arm that contains information about the arm data (robot serial no., robot model), mastering (calibration data of the individual robot axes), and also handles the inputs and outputs in the robot arm. Depending on the robot model, you will find a different number of available signals.

name: Chelsea Technologies
text: A humanoid is a robot or artificial being designed to resemble the human form, often including a head, torso, arms, and legs. Humanoids may mimic human movements, gestures, and even facial expressions, making them suitable for environments where interacting with people or handling human-centered tasks is essential. They often incorporate advanced technologies such as sensors, cameras, and AI, which enable them to perceive their surroundings, recognize human faces or voices, and respond appropriately.  Humanoids are often developed to assist in various roles, including customer service, education, healthcare, and research. By closely resembling human form and behavior, they offer a natural, intuitive interaction style that makes people more comfortable in communicating and working with them. The design of humanoids aims to bridge the gap between human and robotic interaction, creating a collaborative environment and allowing for a wide range of real-world applications.

text: https://lnkd.in/eyiGpa4S The article "How To Disassemble and Clean Your Hellcat" from The Armory Life elaborates on maintaining the Springfield Armory Hellcat 9mm pistol. As part of a video series called the "Springfield Armory Workbench," the article is one of a five-part series intended to educate new firearm owners, especially those who purchased arms in 2020, a record year for gun sales. The article begins by noting the influx of new gun owners and emphasizes the significance of understanding the care and upkeep of their firearms, particularly the Hellcat, a popular compact carry gun.  The article provides detailed guidance on disassembling the Hellcat for cleaning. Key steps include ensuring the firearm is unloaded, removing the slide, and accessing the recoil spring assembly and barrel. For cleaning, it suggests using appropriate gun cleaning products like lubricants and brushes. It highlights essential safety measures, such as always treating guns as loaded and maintaining trigger discipline. Readers are urged to consult the owner's manual for advice specific to their firearm model.  Additionally, the article stresses the importance of regular cleaning, especially for carry guns that accumulate dust and lint in daily use. Monthly cleaning is recommended for guns carried regularly, with more frequent maintenance for those used in practice sessions or competitions. The series also underscores the community-building aspect of owning firearms, encouraging readers to engage with forums and discussions hosted by The Armory Life for further insights and information.

name: Ken Segelhorst
position: ‚åñ Defense Professional Specializing in Information Warfare & Special Operations ‚åñ Green Beret Veteran ‚åñ Diplomat ‚åñ Educator ‚åñ Author ‚åñ SOTF Fellow ‚åñ Firearms Instructor ‚åñ Advocate for Military Families ‚åñ
text: The A-10 has officially exited the Korean Peninsula, ending an era where the infamous Warthog‚Äôs teeth served as a deterrent to North Korean aggression. This marks yet another chapter in the United States Air Force's long campaign to retire an aircraft that has repeatedly proven its worth on the battlefield.  With the A-10 out of the picture, it‚Äôs no wonder North Korea feels comfortable enough to send thousands of its soldiers to Russia's invasion of Ukraine. After all, they no longer need to keep as many eyes (and ears) to the sky, worried about the unmistakable growl of an A-10 delivering its signature ordnance! (Half joking - Half serious!)  On a more serious note, the A-10 has been a cornerstone of U.S. combat operations for decades, providing unparalleled support to ground forces. Its departure from Korea highlights a broader trend of the Air Force shedding the close air support mission - without offering a viable alternative. The F-35, despite its shiny reputation, remains incapable of matching the A-10‚Äôs effectiveness in this role. (Source:)  The A-10 debate transcends the aircraft itself. It's about preserving the trust and reliability ground forces have come to depend on for decades. Removing the A-10 without a capable replacement risks leaving a critical gap in the close air support mission - a role that is fundamental to protecting and empowering those on the ground. As we look to the future, ensuring our forces have what they need to succeed shouldn‚Äôt be overshadowed by the allure of newer technology that fails to meet the same standard.  //,,,,

text: Recent unidentified drone incursions over U.S. Air Force bases in the UK are more than a startling headline; they're a wake-up call about the evolving landscape of military security. The deployment of British counter-drone specialists underscores a critical need: as drones become both accessible and sophisticated, military defenses must evolve in tandem.  Are we witnessing the dawn of a new arms race in the skies? If these drones are indeed state-sponsored, we risk escalating geopolitical tensions. If operated by non-state actors, it highlights an urgent need for stricter drone regulations.  This situation presents a dual opportunity: military contractors are poised to benefit from increased demand for counter-drone technologies, while governments must grapple with balancing security needs against civil liberties.  In a world where every technological leap presents both opportunity and risk, the time for robust conversation and action is now. Your thoughts?

name: Richard Johnson
text: https://lnkd.in/ekciaJqN The article by Joe Kurtenbach on The Armory Life reviews the M1A Scout Squad rifle from Springfield Armory. This semi-automatic rifle, chambered in .308 Winchester, boasts an efficient muzzle brake attached to its 18-inch barrel for quick target acquisition and retention. Kurtenbach extensively evaluates its performance and provides insights into its historical connection with military use, specifically the M14 rifle legacy.  Kurtenbach recounts his first experience with the M14 during military training in Korea and the rifle's legacy as a robust, reliable weapon appreciated for its accuracy and power. Despite being phased out for lighter models like the M16 in the U.S. armed forces, the M14 continued to be prized by military snipers and marksmen for its long-range precision and power. This historical context frames the review of the M1A Scout Squad, highlighting its direct lineage to the M14.  The M1A Scout Squad, part of Springfield Armory's M1A series, maintains the classic wood stock design for traditionalists and offers modern features like a detachable magazine system and advanced muzzle brake. Notably, its 18-inch barrel makes it more maneuverable, with added Picatinny rail space for optics. Testing revealed impressive accuracy and handling, validating the rifle's appeal to both traditional and modern firearm enthusiasts for various applications, from defensive use to competitive shooting.

name: Dak Hardwick
position: Foreign Affairs | Global Security & Trade | Export Controls | Aerospace and Defense
text: hashtag #Production vs  hashtag #mobilization....  With the holiday season upon us, this week's  hashtag #sundayreadstarts a series of options for those looking to tear through some pages when you need a break from --- extended family time.  I've been focused on defense industrial base ( ) and lately. I distinguish production and mobilization this way: production is something you do in regional conflicts and (relative) peacetime. Mobilization is when your entire economy is diverted for the purposes of war. Production is limited to the existing ; mobilization brings non-defense industry sectors in and makes them part the . They are also the first sectors that exit the when the conflict is over.  The academics here may disagree with my rough characterization, but that's how I see it.  Let's peek at the past and show the last time the U.S. mobilized (not produced) for war: the Arsenal of Democracy. Two volumes as a choice:  ‚û° "Freedom's Forge" by Arthur Herman ‚û° "A Call to Arms" by Maury Klein  I've read "Freedom's Forge" cover to cover. I use "A Call to Arms" as a reference guide when I want more details on something, be it price controls, labor/management relations, raw materials access, government organization, scale of the effort, or funding the war. "Freedom's Forge" is a Cliff Notes version of "A Call to Arms."  More recommendations to follow!

text: Buddy Rich tegen robodrummer ZRob: ,,Try this, you little AI motherf*****!‚Äô‚Äô ü•Å  Newly developed robot can play the drums, listen and learn | University of Oslo  It seems simple: The robot ZRob, a small machine easily placed on a table, holds a drumstick and beats a drum. In reality, it is anything but simple. ZRob's arm has a flexible grip, just like the human wrist. It also has an artificial intelligence (AI) that helps it optimize its movements.  If you put several ZRobs together, they can play drum rolls, which requires very fine movements. They can also play rhythms entirely different from what humans can achieve but with a touch of human sensitivity.  "Playing together, the robots will find a pattern unlike everything else," Mojtaba Karbasi says. He has developed ZRob as part of a doctoral thesis at the RITMO Center for Interdisciplinary Studies in Rhythm, Time and Motion, University of Oslo. Karbasi will defend his dissertation November 29.  It seems simple: The robot ZRob, a small machine easily placed on a table, holds a drumstick and beats a drum. In reality, it is anything but simple. ZRob's arm has a flexible grip, just like the human wrist. It also has an artificial intelligence (AI) that helps it optimize its movements.  If you put several ZRobs together, they can play drum rolls, which requires very fine movements. They can also play rhythms entirely different from what humans can achieve but with a touch of human sensitivity.  "Playing together, the robots will find a pattern unlike everything else," Mojtaba Karbasi says. He has developed ZRob as part of a doctoral thesis at the RITMO Center for Interdisciplinary Studies in Rhythm, Time and Motion, University of Oslo. Karbasi will defend his dissertation November 29.    Embodied intelligence for drumming; a reinforcement learning approach to drumming robots | by Seyed Mojtaba Karbasi et al.| Frontiers in Robotics and AI  This paper investigates the potential of the intrinsically motivated reinforcement learning (IMRL) approach for robotic drumming.  (...) This work suggests new insights into the potential of embodied intelligence for musical performance.

text: The Space Force‚Äôs acquisition arm has tapped defense technology firm Anduril to upgrade the service‚Äôs Space Surveillance Network (SSN) with enhanced autonomous networking capabilities, the company announced Thursday.  Under the five-year, $99.7 million indefinite-delivery/indefinite-quantity (ID/IQ) contract, Anduril will integrate its Lattice software into the SSN to create a mesh network that will enable autonomous processing and distribution of data from the architecture‚Äôs vast network of military space sensors. U.S. Space Command has directed the firm to complete deploying the capability by the end of 2026, according to a company press release.

name: Messanga-Messanga Frederic Mike Yvan
position: Aircraft Maintenance Technician | Ensuring Safety & Efficiency in Aviation.
text: Airbus reportedly wins France‚Äôs Maritime Patrol Aircraft program over Dassault  Unconfirmed reports suggest that the French Ministry of the Armed Forces has chosen Airbus Defence & Space over Dassault Aviation for its future maritime patrol aircraft (Patmar) program, according to information from La Tribune. Supposedly, this decision has been communicated to both manufacturers, but it has yet to be publicly announced by official authorities. The Patmar program aims to replace France‚Äôs fleet of 18 Atlantique 2 (ATL2) maritime patrol aircraft by 2030.  The Dassault-Breguet ATL2 entered service in 1992 in the Marine Nationale, though it is based on the Breguet Atlantic, an airframe developed in the 1960s. Powered by two Rolls-Royce Tyne engines, the aircraft has a maximum speed of 600 kilometers per hour and a range of over 7,300 kilometers. It can carry up to 3.5 tons of armaments, including depth charges, mines, and torpedoes, and fire MBDA AM-39 Exocet anti-ship missiles.  Airbus vs. Dassault: Contrasting philosophies in Maritime Patrol Aircraft proposals Two proposals were in competition for this contract: Airbus Defence & Space submitted a military variant of the A321XLR (Extra Long Range), while Dassault Aviation offered a modified version of the Falcon 10X business jet. The A321XLR was certified in July 2024 and entered service with Iberia on November 6, 2024. The aircraft boasts an 11-hour flight endurance and offers significant payload capacity, enabling it to carry an extensive array of equipment for the French Navy‚Äôs missions once converted.  This future A321MPA was first presented at the Euronaval 2024 trade show, held in Paris between November 4 and 7, 2024. The main modification visible on the presented model was a long ammunition bay located underneath the fuselage. Thales is set to supply the sensor suite for this aircraft. In contrast, Dassault emphasized the speed and agility of its Falcon 10X, which should enter service in 2025. The manufacturer also highlighted its experience in the domain. Militarized versions of the Falcon 10, 20 (200 Gardian), and 50 participate in surveillance and rescue missions within the French maritime territory, pilot training, and the transportation of authorities. Seven Albatros maritime surveillance and intervention aircraft based on Dassault‚Äôs Falcon 2000LXS business jet should be delivered to the French Navy in 2025.  However, it appears that ultimately the French authorities favored the A321XLR based on its superior payload capacity, which better aligns with operational needs despite its higher cost. The ministry has reportedly allocated ‚Ç¨89 million to the program, including ‚Ç¨8 million earmarked for 2025.

name: Galin Mihalev
text: hashtag #LeonardoRobot  hashtag #LeonardoMechanicalKnight hashtag #LeonardoDaVinci   The 15th century technology shapes what comes next.  's mechanical knight, discovered by historian in 1957, was a fascinating creation designed in 1495. It featured German-Italian armor and was possibly brought to life by da Vinci later that year based on his notes. The machine may have made an appearance at a celebration for in . This innovative creation, with gears and pulleys, was designed to move its arms and legs, sit, and stand. Modern replicas by and showcased even more advanced capabilities, such as a functional jaw and neck movement. This groundbreaking humanoid robot by da Vinci paved the way for 's planetary exploration robots and remains an inspiration to robotics enthusiasts worldwide. 's ancient dream has finally become a reality, all thanks to and a bunch of other clever folks.

text: Dutch military faces a tough mission: finding space to prepare for war - Defense News  "As the armed forces of the Netherlands expand again after three decades of budget cuts, they‚Äôre looking to step up everything from live fire exercises to low-level helicopter training and ammo stockpiles. The government is puzzling how to fit additional defense activity in a country more densely populated than any of its NATO allies, and where military terrain left empty after the Cold War was converted to civilian use by planners hungry for space." text: Check out  hashtag #OfficerMagazine's new eHandbook explores the proper protocols and approach to Firearms Training & Tactics.  Firearms training doesn‚Äôt just happen on the range. It doesn‚Äôt just happen in the classroom. And it doesn‚Äôt just happen at the beginning of an officer‚Äôs career, never to be expanded on thereafter. Firearms training starts in the classroom, should move to the range, include projected simulation judgmental scenarios and incorporate tools for force-on-force judgmental training as well. The holistic approach to firearms training has to be embraced to provide the officer with the greatest base of knowledge and experience to call upon when use of force is necessary, and survival/victory is the reward for doing everything right.  All the articles featured in this eHandbook are by Lindsey Bertomen. Lindsey is a retired police officer and retired military small arms trainer who has been a contributor to OFFICER Magazine for years. He teaches criminal justice at Hartnell College in Salinas, California, where serves as a POST administrator and firearms instructor.  Download the eHandbook here:

text: On November 16, India‚Äôs Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) conducted a successful flight trial of India‚Äôs first long-range hypersonic missile. text: In the video we see an incredible moment: a robotic arm assisting an individual with a disability to eat independently. Inspired by such breakthroughs, let‚Äôs explore how robotic arms are shaping the future of assistive technologies and what groundbreaking applications we can expect in the coming years.  2024‚Äì2025: Foundational Innovations  ‚Ä¢ For people with disabilities: Compact kitchen arms designed to feed individuals with limited mobility or to assist in holding and lifting objects. ‚Ä¢ For pets: Feeding assistants capable of dispensing precise portions of food. ‚Ä¢ For children: Feeding arms for infants, integrated with safety sensors to detect discomfort or movement.  2026‚Äì2027: Interactive Assistance  ‚Ä¢ For people with disabilities: Arms that assist with dressing, such as buttoning shirts or zipping jackets. ‚Ä¢ For pets: Interactive arms for play, like throwing toys or dispensing treats to encourage exercise. ‚Ä¢ For children: Arms designed to help children with developmental challenges in tasks like drawing or writing.  2028‚Äì2029: Advanced Adaptability  ‚Ä¢ For people with disabilities: Arms with culinary capabilities, capable of chopping vegetables or stirring sauces. Hygiene arms for brushing teeth or washing hands. ‚Ä¢ For pets: Dental hygiene arms specifically designed to clean teeth safely and effectively for dogs and cats. Diagnostic arms that gently restrain animals for check-ups or vaccinations. ‚Ä¢ For children: Creative arms that support arts and crafts, from holding brushes to cutting paper in intricate designs.  2030‚Äì2034: Personalized Integration  ‚Ä¢ For people with disabilities: Multi-functional arms that combine feeding, dressing, and mobility assistance. Diagnostic arms for health monitoring, capable of measuring vitals like blood pressure or oxygen levels. ‚Ä¢ For pets: Training arms that assist in teaching commands or calming anxious animals through soothing movements. Grooming arms that adapt to the size and temperament of the pet. ‚Ä¢ For children: Fully interactive learning arms that grow with the child, adapting to their developmental stages to teach new skills or assist in tasks as they mature.  What do you think? How do you see the development of robotic arms transforming our daily lives, from assistive care to playful innovations?

name: Wevolver
text: QuadWBG: Generalizable Quadrupedal Whole-Body Grasping  Researchers have developed a modular system that combines advanced locomotion and manipulation with a single arm-mounted camera. Using reinforcement learning, it achieves 89% grasping accuracy in real-world conditions, even with transparent objects. The system is capable of handling various tasks across different heights and environments, demonstrating effective whole-body control.  Video source: Challenger42 (YouTube)  Authors: Jilong Wang, Javokhirbek Rajabov, Chaoyi Xu, Yiming Zheng, He Wang  Project Website:

name: Jardel Andrade
position: Editor e apresentador de not√≠cias na R√ÅDIO NOVA 102.5 FM
text: UPDATE TIME (Business) üì°   Russia secures first export contract for Su-57 stealth fighter - Russia's arms export agency, Rosoboronexport, reported that the first export contracts for the supply of fifth-generation Su-57 stealth fighters have been signed. üí∞ üá∑üá∫ üí∞   ‚Äú _The military-technical cooperation system must bring new models of weapons and military equipment to the market. The Su-57 ‚Äì by the way, we already have the first contracts signed for this aircraft_‚Äù, said the head of the company, Alexander Mikheyev, in an interview with the Rossiya 1 TV channel (VGTRK), and published by the TASS agency.  ‚Äú _The economic effect is that we have our market presence and our partners from friendly countries want to buy proven reliable Russian weaponry and correspondingly support our industry with export orders so that we can develop further and, from generation to generation , create new products for the next 10 to 15 years_,‚Äù said Mikheyev.  There were rumors that China could be the likely customer, considering the fact that Russia's United Aircraft Corporation (UAC) brought the aircraft to the China Airshow 2024. The Su-57E's flying displays delighted the crowds at the show even more than China's own aircraft such as the J-20 and J-35.  Yesterday, Dmitry Shugaev, head of the Russian Federal Service for Military-Technical Cooperation, hinted that China would be a customer for Russian military equipment. These are the most modern air defense systems, radar equipment and combat aircraft._‚Äù  Another client could be Algeria, according to unconfirmed reports circulating. Algerian authorities have shown great interest in the Su-57 in the past, visiting its factories and arms fairs in Russia.  The Su-57 is a multi-purpose twin-engine stealth fighter developed by Russian company Sukhoi. It is a product of the PAK FA program, which was started in 1999 as a more modern and affordable alternative to the MFI project. Sukhoi's internal designation for the aircraft is T-50. The Su-57 is the first aircraft in Russian military service designed with stealth technology and is intended to be the basis for a family of stealth combat aircraft.  As a multi-role fighter capable of aerial combat as well as land and sea attack, the Su-57 incorporates stealth, super-maneuverability, super-cruise, integrated avionics and substantial internal payload capability.  The first prototype aircraft flew in 2010, but the program would undergo prolonged development due to several structural and technical problems that arose during testing, including the destruction of the first production aircraft in an accident before its delivery. After repeated delays, the first Su-57 entered service with the Russian Aerospace Forces (VKS) in December 2020. The fighter is expected to have a service life of up to 35 years.   By: Jardel de Almeida Andrade (Angolan Journalist) ‚úíÔ∏è  ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ‚òÜ

text: Larsen & Toubro (L&T) is poised for significant growth in the defence and aerospace sectors, focusing on developing advanced systems for the Indian armed forces and for export. The company is working on next-generation guns, armoured systems, infantry combat vehicles, radars, missile launchers, bridging systems, ships, and submarines. Additionally, L&T is exploring entry into the commercial aerospace market, aiming to produce end-to-end rocket launch vehicles and satellites.  In an exclusive interview, Arun T Ramchandani, senior vice president of L&T Precision Engineering & Systems, expressed ambitious targets, anticipating substantial growth in precision engineering and related businesses over the next 4-5 years. The L&T Group reported revenues of ‚Çπ2,21,113 crore, with the precision engineering segment alone contributing ‚Çπ4,610 crore in FY24, reflecting a significant 41% increase from the previous year.  L&T is nearing a repeat order for 100 K-9 Vajra self-propelled howitzer guns, developed in collaboration with South Korea's Hanwha Defense. This order follows a successful previous supply of 100 guns, completed ahead of schedule in 2021. The new contract, expected to be valued higher due to inflation and fluctuating exchange rates, is awaiting final approval from the Ministry of Defence.  Moreover, L&T is actively developing air defence guns and towed versions for the Indian Army and Air Force, in partnership with Advance Weapons and Equipment India Limited. In March, the company secured a ‚Çπ13,000 crore order for high-power radars, further solidifying its position in the defence sector.  &T

name: East Texas Krav Maga
text: The Principle of "WIN" (Whatever Is Necessary) At the heart of Krav Maga is the principle of "WIN"‚Äîwhatever is necessary to survive. This principle reinforces the idea that in self-defense, the ultimate goal is to protect yourself and escape danger, using whatever tactics are most effective. Forward Planning, Backward Execution Krav Maga practitioners are taught to plan their moves strategically and execute them with precision. Forward planning involves anticipating your attacker‚Äôs next move, identifying escape routes, and making quick decisions to protect yourself. The idea is to be one step ahead of the attacker at all times. Tactical Awareness: Tactical awareness is crucial in self-defense. Krav Maga teaches you how to assess your surroundings, spot potential threats early, and position yourself in a way that maximizes your ability to defend and escape. Preparation for the Unexpected: While forward planning is critical, Krav Maga also emphasizes the importance of flexibility. Not all situations go according to plan, and practitioners are trained to adjust their tactics based on how the encounter unfolds. Practical, Goal-Oriented Techniques Krav Maga is built around practical techniques that aim to neutralize threats as quickly as possible. The objective is not to "win" a fight in the traditional sense but to incapacitate or escape from an attacker in the shortest amount of time. Targeting Vulnerable Areas: Krav Maga techniques focus on striking the attacker‚Äôs vulnerable areas‚Äîeyes, throat, groin, and knees. These areas are chosen because they offer the highest chance of disabling the attacker, regardless of their size or strength. Immediate Counterattacks: In Krav Maga, counterattacks are launched as soon as an attack begins. Practitioners are taught to move forward aggressively, using strikes, knees, and elbows to overwhelm and incapacitate the attacker quickly. The goal is to end the threat as fast as possible. Adaptability in Combat In real-world scenarios, situations can change rapidly, and Krav Maga‚Äôs "WIN" principle teaches practitioners to adapt their techniques to the specific conditions of the fight. Whether facing a single attacker, multiple assailants, or an armed opponent, practitioners must be able to adjust their tactics and techniques in real-time. Key Takeaway: The principle of "WIN" in Krav Maga emphasizes doing whatever is necessary to survive and escape danger. By teaching forward planning, practical techniques, and adaptability, Krav Maga ensures that practitioners are always prepared to handle unexpected situations.

text: India Bolsters Strategic Capabilities: Successful Test Flight of LRLACM  Hyderabad, India (November 14, 2024) - In a significant development for India's defense arsenal, the Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) successfully conducted the maiden flight test of the Long-Range Land-Attack Cruise Missile (LRLACM) on November 12, 2024. The test launch took place from the Integrated Test Range (ITR) at Chandipur, off the coast of Odisha.  A Strategic Leap Forward  The LRLACM is a state-of-the-art missile system designed to enhance India's strategic deterrence capabilities. Key features of this indigenous missile include:  * Extended Range: The missile possesses a substantial range, enabling it to strike targets deep within enemy territory.  * Precision Strike: Equipped with advanced guidance systems, the LRLACM can deliver pinpoint accuracy, ensuring effective mission outcomes.  * Stealth Technology: The missile's stealth capabilities enhance its survivability by reducing its visibility to enemy radars.  * Versatile Launch Platforms: The LRLACM can be launched from various platforms, including land-based systems and naval vessels, providing flexibility in deployment.  A Testament to Indigenous Technological Prowess The successful development and test flight of the LRLACM underscore India's growing indigenous technological capabilities. This achievement is a result of the concerted efforts of DRDO scientists and engineers, who have demonstrated their expertise in missile technology.  Strategic Implications  The induction of the LRLACM into the Indian Armed Forces will significantly bolster India's strategic deterrence capabilities. This potent weapon system will provide India with a credible deterrent against potential adversaries, enabling a robust response to any threats to national security.  Boosting India's Defense Industry The successful development and testing of the LRLACM will also stimulate the growth of India's defense industry. It will create new opportunities for domestic industries to participate in the production and maintenance of the missile system, contributing to the nation's economic growth and technological advancement. In conclusion, the successful maiden flight test of the LRLACM is a significant milestone for India's defense sector. It reinforces India's commitment to self-reliance in defense technologies and strengthens its position as a major global military power.  * reference:

It is able to reproduce human movements thanks to a system of inverse kinematics.  Equipped with a webcam and advanced software, the humanoid interacts with the environment as if it were being controlled directly by an operator. Currently, the robot has a functional torso and a working right arm, while the left arm is in the final stages of development. Using a webcam, it tracks human movements and reproduces them in real time.  The robot is based on an system, which is used in complex engineering tasks such as controlling particle gas pedals. A team of students is now working on creating legs for the humanoid so it can walk.
